loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is one of the many women who have to take care of and bring up her children alone, by working hard and through the many problems that can emerge in an agricultural business. Susanna has a small and well-run farm. She keeps two cows, two bulls, two piglets, 12 sheep and 25 chickens. As a result of working night and day, Susanna manages to sell some meat, dairy products and eggs, right from her house to her loyal customers and neighbors. A plot of land that she owns also brings a little income to her family; from her fruit garden she manages to sell apples and apricots.

Susanna and her family live in the village Ddmashen, which is in the Gegharkunik area. Susanna’s husband is in the Russian Federation working abroad. From time to time, he helps his family financially. Nonetheless, the couple has not been able to save enough money to care for the needs of their three children and, at the same time, to cover the upkeep of their farm. Among numerous maintenance problems in her farm, Susanna wants to solve the one that is the most urgent now -- she wants to repair the barn for her farm animals. To do this, she needs 800.000 Armenian drams of loan capital, and she also will buy some animal fodder. She thanks beforehand her Kiva lenders, and she anticipates your support.

loans.use: To repair the barn and to buy some animal fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an inventory of essential grocery items to sell

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is from Sverdlov village of Lori region. He is a farmer with 20 years of experience and his farm currently includes seven cows, pigs, 20 chickens and 10 colonies of bees. Hovhannes also owns a plot of agricultural land where he cultivates potatoes and wheat. The gathered harvest he sells locally and gets income which is vital for covering the family's daily costs.
By applying for this loan, Hovhannes wants to increase his livestock by two cows. The loan also will be used for purchasing fertilizer which is very important for successful cultivation of the land.  Hovhannes does his best to provide his children with a beautiful life, a good education, food and clothing. Hovhannes lives with his wife and three children. This loan is very important for him to gather more income and continue his farming business. Hovhannes waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for 2 cows and fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah runs a retail shop in Makueni town. He has been in this business for four years and it has been profitable. He is 54 years of age, married and has seven children.

This will be his fourth loan term from KADET LTD and he plans to buy more stock of soap detergents, sugar, rice, cooking oil, and flour, as well as kitchen utensils such as plates and cups. He will use the generated income to pay school fees for his children. 

He hopes to grow his business and make more income and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soap detergents, sugar, rice, cooking oil, flour, as well as kitchen utensils such as plates and cups

loans.name: Old-Lady

texts.en:
This is Old-lady from Liberia.  She lives in Paynesville North, which is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia.  Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County.  The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county.  As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

Old-lady is 32.  She is married and has five children.  Her children's ages are between 15 and 5.  They  all are currently living at home and in school.  
Old-lady has owned her own table business selling pepper, red oil, cold water, etc. for the past three years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase pepper, red oil, cold water, etc.  On average, she works 10 hours at her business.  She started her business with money given to her by her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi.  She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the profit she makes every time.  In the future, she would like to buy a piece of land and build a house.  She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase pepper, red oil, cold water etc.

loans.name: Musarrat

texts.en: Musarrat, age 48, is a married woman and a mother of two. She is eager to support her family so she has been doing a business of shoe making for many years. During a year of her business she had low capital because she faced problems in receiving payments on time and was unable to expand her business. At that point in time, she was afraid of taking informal loans from relatives so then she contacted Kashf foundation on the suggestion of her neighbor.  It’s her 8th year with Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of Rs.40,000 to buy raw material including leather, colorful threads and plastic soles. In this way, she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to buy raw material including leather, colorful threads and plastic soles.

loans.name: Shahjhan

texts.en:
Shahjhan is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of six. She has been tailoring for 3 years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household and the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family. 

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons and lace. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demands of her customers on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a high-quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons and lace.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles does a tailoring business in Nairobi town. He is 45 years old, married and has five children. He has been in this business for the past 21 years and it has been profitable. He gets a monthly income of 7,000 KES. 

This will be his fifth loan term from KADET LTD and he plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of textile materials for sewing. He also plans to buy more threads, buttons and zips as well as an iron box. He will use the generated income to buy another sewing machine.

He hopes to expand his business and open another tailoring shop and hence, to make more income and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy textile materials for use in business.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is a Kiva borrower and she describes herself as optimistic and determined.  She has taken a loan of Kes 32,700 to purchase a water tank that four members of her family will benefit from.  The family faces lack of water due to the long dry season in the area. They will be able to harvest rain water during the rainy season.  She runs a hotel and also sells cereals to earn an income. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: purchase a water tank

loans.name: Gloria Alba

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Gloria con su anterior credikiva, pues con el pudo comprar materias primas e inusmos como telas hilos correderas, broches etc. Su negocio quedó muy surtido y ella está muy contenta. En l actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo finaciamiento mediante el cual comprara telas para fabricar chalecos que es el producto que mas vende, y planea  una vez mas, hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Gracias por su colaboración y que Dios los bendiga. "
texts.en: Thanks for supporting Gloria with her last Kiva loan, which allowed her to buy raw materials and supplies such as fabric, thread, zippers, clasps, and more. Her business was kept stocked up and she is very happy. Currently, she is applying for another loan. With this new financing, she will buy fabric to make vests, which is her best-selling product. So she is planning to make a successful investment with her Kiva loan once again. Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: "Thanks for your contribution and may God bless you."

loans.use: to buy fabric to make vests

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Fatu from Port Loko Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married and has three children between the ages of four and 16 years, and has two additional dependents who live with her because they are relatives. In 2002, Fatu established her general stock business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business every day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Fatu requires a loan in order to buy more body cream, soap, and assorted drinks. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business so she can attract customers and improve her family's living conditions.  In the future, Fatu plans to import her goods from a neighboring country. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more body cream, soap, and assorted drinks

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en: Fouzia, age 51, is widow and mother of one child. She has been actively involved in the business of cloth sales. She purchases a variety of cloths from the market and then sells them in her locality. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. She needs capital to meet with the increasing demands of her customers. She has already taken six loans from Kashf foundation in the past. With a good repayment history, she has applied for her seventh loan of Rs 35,000 to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers to grow her sales. She hopes to generate more revenue and plans to spend part of it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Sofoci 4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sofoci 4 fait partie de la coopérative CPSL et est située à Meagui, une petite ville au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région du Bas Sassandra, proche de Soubré. Le groupe est composé de 9 personnes. 
Boukary a 54 ans et il est un membre du groupe Sofoci 4. Il s'occupe de 7 personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 4 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative CPSL et il a 3 hectares de cacao en cours de double certification Rain Forest Alliance/UTZ, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais et des produits phytosanitaires pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il veut construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
The group "Sofoci 4" is part of the CPSL cooperative and is located in Meagui, a small town in southwestern Cote-d'Ivoire, in the Région de Bas-Sassandra, near Soubré. The group is composed of nine persons. 

Boukary is 54 years old, and he is a member of the group "Sofoci 4". He takes care of seven persons at home. For four years, he has been part of the CPSL cooperative. He has three hectares of cocoa in the process of a Rain Forest Alliance/UTZ double certification, which means he respects the principles and standards of sustainable agriculture. 

Thanks to this loan, he is going to be able to purchase manure and pesticides for his plantation. These products will enable him to augment his production and thus to increase his revenues. 

With the additional money, he wants to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure and pesticides for his cocoa plantation

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which lies in the tea growing region of Kenya. She has three children and has been doing this work for five  years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea.  She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Poultry keepin!"  Her biggest challenge is 'Outbreak of diseases.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Tuiyei.'

Evaline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Because of low interest rates.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'It offer loans at lower rate.'  Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Evaline replied, 'The family assets will increase.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Evaline owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, running water, TV' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, sewing machine, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction of a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Nasim

texts.en: Nasim is a 34-year-old married woman and mother of one child. She is motivated to provide everything for her family. That is why she has been running a general store with the support of her husband for a period of about two years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store, she requested a loan for 20,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as hopeful. She has taken a loan of 21,000 KES to buy a water tank. Eight members of her family will benefit from the water tank. The family faces the challenge of accessing water for daily use during the dry season. With this water tank, they will be able to harvest rainwater during the rainy season. She runs a retail shop to earn an income. She hopes that in future she will be able to educate and feed her children.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses the campus of Mt. Kenya University. He has 1 child and has been doing this work for 5 years. His primary income sources are milk and tea.

He states that growing crops and rearing livestock are his favorite parts of his job. His biggest challenge is cultivating. One of his animals has been given the name of Moo.

Geoffrey was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Low interest rates." This client was also asked what he learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "It finances low income earners."

His highest monthly expenses are school fees. He said that the loan will improve his family's standards of living. 

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Geoffrey owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net and electricity, but does not have solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Suzanne Noelle

texts.fr: Suzanne est une femme de 48 ans commerçante.Elle fait la vente en détail (tomate, huile, posson fuméarachides...) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 5 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter son stock pour mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Suzanne is a 48-year-old woman merchant who has a retail trade in tomatoes, oil, smoked fish, peanuts,… according to the season. She has been selling at a local market for five years. She has good knowledge of suppliers and especially of her customer base, which she has acquired over the course of time, thanks to her experience in this domain. 

But she constantly finds herself short of inventory because she has to sell her entire inventory before procuring more again. This is due to her meager capital. She would like to increase her inventory to do better satisfying the constant demand from her customers and to avoid inventory shortages. She will save her profits for not only expanding her business but also providing for her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of seasonal foods to sell

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Isatu from Port Loko. She is married and has two children between the ages of 11 months and 6 years. Her children are currently going to school. Her business income is not enough to support the home. 

Isatu sells general stock items at her house; she sells soap, milk, pure water, and sweets. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night.   Isatu says that during the rainy season purchasing power is very slow.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to buy more soap, milk, pure water and biscuits. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soap, milk, pure water and biscuits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Raya

texts.en: Raya is a 23 year-old single lady, living with her five brothers and sisters. Together they support themselves after their father passed away. Now Raya is a university student majoring in cultural tourism. She is seeking an educational loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Mariatu from Port Loko in the northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 8 years and 15 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 2010, Mariatu established her cookery business. She began her business because she was trained with business and she thinks it is more profitable. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the price inflation of goods.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, rice, cooking seasoning and drinks. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her standard of living and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Mariatu plans to buy a plot of land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, cooking season and drinks.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Don miguel de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 13 años de de edad, él  posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 4 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocido por los vecinos de la zona, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, él quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel, 45, lives in his own home with his wife and 13 year-old child.  He has a store where he sells basic consumer goods such as: beans, milk, bread, and other items.  He's had this business for 4 years, and this has given him a lot of experience in sales that allows him to get better earnings.  His business is located in his house in a very busy location, and it's well known by the neighbors in the area.  He has attracted a lot of customers, because his store is well stocked.  

Miguel wants to expand the business and make a new investment, but he needs capital.  This is why he is requesting a loan that will enable him to buy the products he needs for his store.  He is certain that he will pay off this debt, and he also trusts that with this loan he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other products

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 20 year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and mother of one child. For the past two years, she has been running a business of cloth sales. She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Nadia is requesting a loan of Rs 30,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is a 42 year-old married lady and mother of five children. She has been actively involved in the business of cloth trade for the past eight years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. She requested a loan of Rs 25,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan which will allow her to generate more revenue to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Shumila

texts.en: Shumila is a 30 year-old married woman and a mother of four. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs.15,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons. In this way she will be to complete the orders of her customers on time. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to utilize part of the revenue on providing a better standard of living to her children.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons..

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 30-year-old single man who has one brother. They are living together and supporting each other and their mother after their father passed away. He started at home selling shawls and a few items of female clothing, and now he has a humble shop selling female clothes in the market. Ahmad is seeking a youth loan to add a few occasional dresses to the collection he has in the shop.

loans.use: to add a few occasional dresses to the collection he has in the shop.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 47-year-old Isatu from Port loko. She is married with two children. She has two relatives at home. One of her daughters is currently in collage. 

Isatu runs a food stand business at her house; she sells palm oil, rice, milk, sugar and cooking oil. She has been running this business since 1980. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. At present, she says her business is doing well.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to buy more food commodities like palm oil, rice, milk, sugar and cooking oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her family. In the future, she plans to educate her children up to university. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more food commodities like palm oil, rice, milk, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es: Vanesa, de 35 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 16 y  04 años de edad respectivamente. Vanesa se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, entre otros, este negocio lo ha establecido en la vereda de su casa y adicionalmente a esto vende gaseosas, hielo y helados con los que también genera el dinero necesario para la alimentación y el pago de algunos gastos propios del día, mientras que su esposo aporta el dinero que obtiene trabajando como chofer de mototaxi. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que no le demanda mucho esfuerzo y puede mantenerse en reposo, manteniendo controlada su salud ya que hace un tiempo el doctor le recomendó descanso médico, le agrada el ritmo con el que va creciendo su puesto de venta. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner una bodega que le permita mantener su clientela y al mismo tiempo incrementar la cantidad y variedad de los artículos que vende actualmente. Este es su octavo crédito con Kiva razón y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido para seguir adelante , razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.3000 soles comprará productos tales como arroz, azúcar , leche , conservas de pescado , entre otros.
texts.en:
Vanesa, 35 years old, is a kind and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and 2 children ages 16 and 4. Vanesa works by selling food products such as rice, sugar, beans, and other items. She established this business on the sidewalk of her house. She also sells soft drinks, ice, and ice cream, which also generate income that is necessary to buy food and pay for daily expenses. Her husband contributes the money he earns as a mototaxi driver.

What she likes most about her job is that it doesn't demand a lot of effort and she can rest and stay health since awhile ago, her doctor told her to rest for medical reasons. She likes the pace at which her sales booth is growing. With time, she hopes to put together the money needed to set up a small grocery store, which will allow her to maintain her customer base, and also increase the quantity and variety of items she currently sells.

This is her eighth loan with Kiva and she feels very grateful for the financial help she is receiving so she can continue moving forward. For this reason, she promises to make punctual payments. With the requested amount of 3000 soles, she will buy products such as rice, sugar, milk, canned fish, and more.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk, and other items.

loans.name: Marlene Yanet

texts.es:
Marlene, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo  préstamo porque requiere de mas capital de trabajo; este le permitirá comprar blusas, faldas, chores, pantalones, ropa interior, sandalias, entre otra mercadería. 
El credito anterior  le ayudo a mejorar su negocio, aumentar el inventario e incremento en las ventas; las condiciones economicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en: Marlene is in need of a new loan because she needs more working capital which would allow her to purchase blouses, skirts, shorts, pants, underwear, sandals and other merchandise.  The previous loan helped her improve her business, increase her inventory and increase her sales.  Furthermore, her financial and family conditions have improved.

loans.use: purchase blouses, skirts, shorts, pants, underwear, sandals and other merchandise.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda is a 44-year-old conservative woman, so she asked one of her sons to appear in the photo instead. 

Ayda’s husband works at the airport hotel, while she looks after their five sons. One of them is now 20 years old, a university student majoring in accounting. Ayda decided to apply for an educational loan to help her son in his studies and pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's next semester fees.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 31-year-old Marie from Port Loko. She is married and has three children. Her children are currently going to school. Her income is not enough to support the home. 

Marie runs a bar and restaurant at her house. She sells stout, start beer and snacks. She has been running this business since 2003. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night.  Marie says that her business is going well because she started with a small amount through BRAC.

Marie has requested a loan in order to buy assorted drinks like start beer, stout, soft drinks and prepared food for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and expand her business. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy assorted drinks like start beer, stout, soft drinks and prepared food for resale.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 24 year-old single man.  As Khaled has a big family of 10 members, excluding himself, he helps in supporting the family by working at a cell phone shop. Khaled also goes to the university to get a bachelors degree in English Language. He hopes that later on he can also go on with his studies and get a master's degree, too. But now Khaled is seeking an educational loan to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es: Doña rosa de 41 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de tilapias (peces) desde hace 4 años tiene mucha clientela que la busca porque vende las tilapias a buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo, sus hijos ya son independientes y viven en otra casa pero le ayudan en algunas ocasiones, doña rosa esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar alimentos para engordar tilapias y poder mejorar el estanque donde  realiza el cultivo que es el que muestra la fotografía, para seguir con su trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa is 41 years old and for the past 4 years has been raising tilapia.  She has a lot of clients that look for her because she sells tilapia at a very good price.  With her earnings, she is able to cover certain costs at home.  She lives in her own home with her husband.  Her children are already independent and live in their own home but they help her from time to time.  Rosa is requesting this loan in order to purchase food to fatten up her tilapia and to improve the tank that she keeps them in, which is the one shown in the picture.  This will allow her to continue with her work and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: purchase food for tilapia and improve the tank where she farms them.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora, de 47 años de edad, está casada con Leni  y junto a él tiene 2 hijos de 25 y 23 años de edad respectivamente, juntos viven en su casa propia. El trabajo de Dora consiste en la venta de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, panes, huevos, aceite, verduras, entre otros. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa en donde atiende todos los días y a tiempo completo. Lleva en este negocio un promedio de 11 años y lo realiza sola, por fortuna le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para cumplir otras actividades eventuales, afortunadamente tiene buenos ingresos ya que siempre tienen clientes gracias a la variedad de los productos que ofrece y además porque tiene la única tienda en su zona.
Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante , razón por la cual se compromete a salir adelante con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500 soles, comprará mercadería para su venta tales como arroz, azúcar, panes, huevos, leche, aceites verduras y otros
texts.en:
Dora, 47 years old, is married to Leni and together they have 2 children aged 25 and 23; together they live in their own home.  Dora's work consists of selling food products such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, vegetables, etc... She operates this business from her home, and attends to it everyday at all times.  She has had this business for 11 years and she manages it on her own; fortunately she has been doing well.  What she enjoys about her work is that she has time to fulfill other possible activities.  Fortunately, she has good revenues since they always have clients, thanks to the variety of products that she offers and due to the fact that she has the only store in the area. 

This is her fourth loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for the loan opportunities that they offer and the financial backing that she needs to continue getting ahead, which is the reason why she is committed to succeed with her business.  With the requested amount of 1500 soles, she will purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar, bread, eggs, milk, oil, vegetables, etc...

loans.use: purchase food products such as rice, sugar, breads, eggs, milk, oil, vegetables, etc...

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz, vende sus productos en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtienen y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante y cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar. La clienta está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar abonos, herbicidas, fertilizantes, semillas, herramientas, etc.  y seguir con sus cosechas ya que esa única fuente de trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The borrower lives with her husband and two children in a house they own.  She works as a farmer, especially cultivating corn.  She sells her products at the markets close to her home.  With the income she earns and the help her of husband, they are succeeding in getting ahead and covering their household expenses.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase manure, herbicide, fertilizer, seeds, and tools to continue with her crops since that is her only source of work.  She hopes to give her family a more stable financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicide, fertilizer, seeds, and tools.

loans.name: Venancio

texts.es: Don Venancio de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a trabajar de jardinero en una residencial que esta cerca de su casa desde hace 25 años, con el pago de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposa logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  don Venancio esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar una lámpara solar que es la que muestra en la fotografía, ya que es muy importante para su vivienda y con lo que gana en su trabajo no le alcanza para poder comprarla.
texts.en:
Venancio is 52 years old and lives in a house he owns with his wife.  He has worked for 25 years as a gardener at a private home that is close to his house.  With his income and his wife's help, they succeed in meeting their household expenses.  

Venancio is requesting this loan to purchase a solar lamp, which he is showing in the photograph.  It is very important for his home and with his income, he is not able to purchase one.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: Don nicolas de 48 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 25 años su principal siembra es la cosecha de hortalizas vende sus productos en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia,  es un hombre responsable, trabajador y honesto, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 16 años de edad, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, don nicolas esta solicitando un crédito para comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, herramientas, etc. para seguir con sus cosechas y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 48 years old and has worked as a farmer for 25 years.  The main crop that he plants is vegetables.  He sells his products in the markets close to his home.  He is a responsible, hard-working, and honest man.  He lives in a home he owns with his wife and 16 year old son.  With the income he earns from his sales, he is able to meet his household expenses.

Nicolas is requesting this loan to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and tools to continue with his crops and to be able to give his family a more stable financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and tools.

loans.name: Javier Libardo

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 35 años, casado con Jenny de su misma edad quien realiza quehaceres domésticos, Javier es comerciante y ha desempeñado muy bien su trabajo a pesar de haber cursado solamente la instrucción secundaria. Tiene un hijo que aún no estudia y está al cuidado de su madre Jenny. Este hombre se esfuerza por siempre llevar el sustento a su familia a pesar de que su salud se vea deteriorada cada vez. Él vive actualmente en Parroquia de Río Verde, un lugar histórico de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Javier desde hace 3 años se dedica a la compra – venta de artículos para el hogar como tinas, cobijas, alfombras, tostadoras, etc. Es un trabajo que lo realiza de forma ambulante y lo aprendió de un amigo e invierte al menos 8 horas cada día de la semana laboral. El objetivo principal que ahora tiene es extender su negocio hacia nuevas zonas de la provincia para lo cual necesita comprar nuevos productos y es por esto que está solicitando un préstamo que le permitirá ampliar su negocio y así podrá un día hacer realidad su sueño de establecer en un local fijo donde sus clientes le busquen y puedan encontrar todo lo que necesitan, además así podrá pasar más tiempo con su familia y su salud mejorará. Javier encontró en Fundación Alternativa un apoyo muy significativo para él, pues en ningún otro lugar aceptaron su petición de crédito y en la Fundación pudo ser posible gracias al producto Kiva.
texts.en:
Javier, 35, is married to Jenny, who is the same age. She is responsible for the household duties. Javier is a salesman who has performed very well in his job, despite having only a secondary school education. He has one son who is not studying yet and is under the care of his mother, Jenny. This man works very hard to provide for his family, although his health is constantly deteriorating. 

He currently lives in Parroquia de Río Verde, a historic area of Santo Domingo, the capital of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. This province of Ecuador has experienced sustained high growth during the past several years. The capital city's delicious fruits and local gastronomy are its most attractive and appealing offers. It also has a significant trade presence, as it has become an onshore "port" between the country's Sierra and Costa regions. It also has several tourist attractions which, along with the temperate climate, are very popular among domestic and foreign tourists. Therefore, the majority of inhabitants have started up some kind of business activity or work in services for inhabitants and tourists.

For three years, Javier has worked in sales, selling home goods such as tubs, blankets, carpets, toasters, etc. He sells these products as a traveling salesman. He learned about the business from a friend, and he invests at least 8 hours per day in his business during the work week. Currently, his main goal is expanding his business to new areas of the province. Therefore, he needs to buy new products, which is why he has applied for a loan which will allow him to expand his business. He will then be able to achieve his dream of establishing a business property where his clients can visit him and find everything they need. He will also be able to spend more time with his family and his health will improve. Javier found meaningful support in Fundación Alternativa, because he was not accepted for a loan in any other place. At Fundación Alternativa, this was possible thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy home goods and expand his distribution area.

loans.name: Dora Morena

texts.es: Doña dora de 52 años de edad ella vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dora, 52, lives in her own house with her son. She has a store where she sells staple goods such as beans, milk, eggs, and bread, among others. She has had this business for many years. This has given her the sales experience she needs to achieve the best profits. Her business is located in her home, which is in a very busy area. She is well-known among her neighbors in the area and she has a large clientele because she keeps her store stocked. 

She would like to expand her business and make a new investment, but she needs capital to do so. Therefore, she has applied for a loan which will allow her to buy all she needs for her store. She is sure that she will pay off her debt and she is also confident that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soup, coffee, corn, beans, eggs, milk, sweet bread, chocolate, and other products.

loans.name: El Cruce Hacia El Futuro  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Cruce hacia el Futuro está formado por 8 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia Sinincay en Cuenca, lugar que goza verdes campos, de una iglesia que profesa la religión de su población. Su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, su fuente de ingresos es la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a ejercer diferentes profesiones, todo tipo de trabajo que ejercen les da la oportunidad de mejorar la estabilidad de sus hogares y así les pueden brindar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Jenny,  lleva 6 años en el grupo de crédito el Cruce hacia el Futuro. Tiene 26 años, es casada y aun no concibe hijos, su esposo labora como empleado público, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.

Doña Jenny tiene negocio propio desde  hace 5 años, es un centro de copia donde también realiza empastado de tesis, vende productos de papelería y  confitería, labora en su negocio de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. en  su casa se dedica a la cría y venta de cuyes. 

Con el dinero de su nuevo crédito va a comprar  una impresora.

Su meta es terminar de construir su casa.

Las fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The El Cruce Hacia El Futuro community bank is made up of eight women who live in the outskirts of the Sinincay parish in Cuenca.  The area enjoys green fields and a church that professes the religion of its population.  The people also maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.  Their sources of income are agriculture, raising animals, commerce, and many go to the city every day to work in different professions.  All of the kinds of work that they do give them the opportunity to improve the stability of their households so that they can provide their children with a better future.

One of the members of the group is Jenny, who has been a member for six years.  She is 26 years old, married, and has no children.  Her husband works as a public employee.  She does not have her own home because she lives with her in-laws, with whom they share the household expenses.

Jenny has had her own business for five years.  It is a copy center where she also covers theses, sells stationary items, and sells candy.  She works at her business from Monday to Saturday from 8:00am until 10:00pm.  In her home, she works raising and selling guinea pigs.  

She will use the money from the loan to purchase a printer.  Her goal is to finish building her home.

The small photos are of two group members who were not able to be present when they took the group photo.

loans.use: to purchase a printer.

loans.name: Maa Kamudei Self Help Group

texts.en:
Sabita is 33 years old, married and has one child. She is a native of the Khurda district, but she lives in the village of Jajpur in Odisha, India. Sabita is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with her work in her business. She has a business growing vegetables and paddy and selling them in the market in Khurda district of Odisha, India. She has already had this business for four years, and it is going very well. At this time, Sabita is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demand.
 
This group is made up of neighbors and friends who formed the group Maa Kamudei Self Help Group. The members of the group have selected Sabita as their president. The lady sitting third from left wearing a blue sari in the photo is Sabita. The common goal of the group is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 44 years old and does a tailoring business in Nairobi town. He is married and has six children. He has been in the tailoring business for 17 years, and it has been profitable. 

This being his fourth loan term from KADET LTD, he plans to buy a sewing machine and sewing materials for use in his business. This will enable him to meet the demands of his customers, and thereby, make more income with which he will pay school fees for his children. 

He hopes to grow his business, make more income and build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and sewing materials for use in his business.

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.ru: Мухамади жизнерадостный  мужчина в возрасте 53 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих дочерей, которые живут со своими мужьями. Мухамади вместе с женой живет в сельской местности. Для того , чтобы иметь доход на проживание, он занимается собственным бизнесом. Мухамади имеет большой опыт в сфере откармливания крупно рогатого скота, а также в сфере выращивания сельскохозяйственной культуры. Основной доход он получает от откармливания и продажи скота. Жена помогает ему в этом деле. Днем она работает в дехканском хозяйстве, а вечером и утром ухаживает за скотом и доит коров. Каждый день коровы дают по 20 литров молока, затем жена продает это молоко местному населению. А Мухамади, параллельно с животноводством, выращивает сельскохозяйственной культуру, и также продаёт полученный урожай. Для выращивания сельскохозяйственной культуры Мухамади имеет земельный участок площадью 3 га. Это дело приносит ему хороший дополнительный заработок. Сейчас Мухамади хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота для получения большей прибыли. Он планирует провести мероприятие в честь внука, но накопленных средств не хватает. Мухамади обратился в организацию Арванд для получения кредита, он на полученный кредит купит скот и надеется на полученную прибыль осуществить свои планы.
texts.en:
Muhamadi is a cheerful 53 year old man.  He is married and has two married daughters.  Muhamadi and his wife live in a rural area.  In order to have an income to support them, he has his own business.  Muhamadi has a great deal of experience in the field of fattening cattle, as well as in farming.  

The main source of their income is from fattening and selling cattle.  His wife helps him with the business.  During the day, she does farm labor, and in the mornings and evenings she takes care of the cattle and milks the cows.  Every day each of their cows gives 20 liters of milk, which his wife sells to people living in the area.  Along with fattening cattle, Muhamadi farms and sells his harvests.  He has 3 ha of land on which he farms and this brings in a nice additional income.  

At present, Muhamadi want to increase the size of his herd in order to earn more profits.  He is planning to have a celebration for his grandson, but he does not have enough money saved up.  Muhamadi has applied to MDO Arvand, LLC for a loan to buy cattle in the hopes that he will be able to pay for the celebration with the profits.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Ann Mahaveer Self Help Group

texts.en: In 2010, 10 women from Balugaon village stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their family. They formed a group named Ann Mahaveer Self Help Group. The members of Ann Mahaveer Self Help Group are all women from the district of Khurda in Odisha, India. One of them is Mrs. Sita, who was selected as their president. The lady standing fifth from right wearing a black sari in the photo is Sita. Sita is 43 years old and is staying with her husband and her three children. Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in cultivation for a long time. She got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her husband, so she gathered some other women from her neighborhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. Initially, she started growing only a few vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, and onions but later on, she grew bitter gourd, snake gourd, cucumbers, ladyfingers and brinjal (eggplant). She has a very good relationship with her customers as she sells fresh vegetables to her customers. Now she has a new idea to purchase more seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to enlarge her vegetable cultivation. For this reason, she has requested a loan to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase land, seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Maa Mangala Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Mangala Self Help Group consists of 10 women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves to share their problems and to solve their problems among themselves.
 
One of them is Jubida, who was selected as the president of Maa Mangala Self Help Group. The lady standing fifth from the left wearing a blue dress in the photo is Jubida. Jubida is 25 years old and is staying with her husband and her only child. She hopes to see her child as an officer in a company. She has a few cows and sells their milk in the village. Her husband supports her in this activity. She has requested a loan of 14,000 INR, which will help her to purchase the required resources for enhancing her dairy business. She says a portion of the loan will help her to purchase cows, repair a cow shed, and to cover operational expenses like food and fodder for cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cows, repair a cow shed, and pay for expenses like food and fodder for cattle.

loans.name: Allah-Jawai

texts.en:
Allah-Jawai is a 53-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of milk sales for the past 10 years. She has three buffaloes in milk. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. She is a mother of seven children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  

She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. Currently, she has applied for a loan of 45,000 rupees to purchase another buffalo. It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La cliente Ana vive en la ciudad de Playas, es una mujer trabajadora que comenzó su negocio vendiendo de casa en casa mercadería como bisutería, ropa para mujeres, zapatos etc. Poco a poco mejoro sus ingresos gracias a su desempeño de trabajar todos los días. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06:00am todos los días. Es madre soltera tiene dos hijos uno de 9 a 6 años que están estudiando. Con el préstamo quiere comprar vitrinas, bisutería, ropa  para asi tener los suficientes ingresos para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Ana lives in the city of Playas. She is a hard-working woman who started her business selling merchandise door-to-door, such as costume jewelry, women's clothing, shoes etc. Little by little she improved her income by working every day.

Currently she is working from 6 a.m. every day. She is a single mother and has two children, 9 and 6,  who are going to school. With the loan she will buy display cases, costume jewelry and clothing so that she can have enough revenue to continue working.

loans.use: To buy display cases, costume jewelry and clothing.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es:
Serapio, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo por la temporada que resulta buena para invertir en la agricultura; este le permitirá comprar los materiales agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y concentrado para el ganado.
El crédito anterior le ayudo de una manera favorable, ya que le permitió crecer en el negocio porque antes solo tenía una vaca y hoy en día cuenta con tres; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: Serapio has applied for a new loan because he needs working capital for this season, when it will be good to invest in agriculture. This loan will allow him to buy necessary agricultural supplies, such as fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and feed for his livestock. His previous loan helped him by allowing him to grow his business. Before, he only had one cow, but now he has three. His financial situation and his family's circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and animal feed.

loans.name: Bilqaees

texts.en:
Bilqaees is a 38-year married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has four years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. 

She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en: Zakaria is a third-year university student majoring in chemistry. He is a 22-year-old single guy living with four siblings and a mother after their father passed away. Now Zakaria is applying for an educational loan to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Zainab from Port Loko in the northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of 8 years and 18 years, and has two additional dependents who live with her because they are relatives. In 2003, Zainab established her general stock business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business every day. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Zainab requires a loan in order to buy more body cream, soap, cigarettes and assorted drinks. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business so she can attract customers and improve her family's standard of living. In the future, Zainab plans to import her goods from a neighboring country. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more body cream, soap, cigarettes and assorted drinks.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a poultry farmer in Kangundo town and has been in this business for the past two years. He supplies chicken and eggs to various hotels and also sells the eggs to shop retailers. He is 32 years old and married with three children. 

This is his first loan term from KADET LTD and he plans to buy more poultry for rearing. He will also buy more stock of poultry feeds. He will use the generated income to open a business for his wife. 

In future, William hopes to grow his business by supplying poultry and eggs in the whole area of Kangundo town and its environs.

loans.use: to buy poultry for rearing and poultry feeds

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан энергичный и целеустремленный человек, который всегда в поисках улучшения условий проживания. Он является жителем города Куляб. Ему 30 лет. Он женат и отец двоих сыновей. Хасан намерен начать предпринимательскую деятельность. Он хочет заняться куплей и продажей фруктов и овощей, так как в сезон лета на них очень хороший спрос. Хасан уже приобрел на рынке города точку продажи. Он запрашивает кредит, чтобы закупить товар. Хасан благодаря этому кредиту сможет начать бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль.
texts.en: Hasan is an energetic and goal oriented man who is constantly seeking to improve his situation. He lives in the city of Kulob. He is married and the father of two sons. Hasan intends to begin his own business. He want to buy and sell fruits and vegetables, as in summer they are in high demand. Hasan already has a stall at the city market. He is asking for a loan to buy goods. Thanks to this loan Hasan will be able to start his business and earn a good income.

loans.use: Buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ibrat

texts.en:
Ibrat is a 43-year-old married woman. She is successfully running a small shop selling milk, with the support of her husband. The man shown in the picture is Ibrat’s husband. They have 5 calves and 2 cows in milk. They milk the cows, store it in cans to keep the milk fresh, and then sell it to the people of her community.

Ibrat is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy one more cow. It will enable them to increase their sales. Ibrat is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy one more cow

loans.name: Suha

texts.en: Suha is a 20-year-old married lady with no kids yet. She is a new student at the university majoring in Business Administration. While her husband is serving with the military, Suha keeps on going to achieve her goal by getting her bachelor degree. Now she is applying for an educational loan to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester fees

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Fatmata from the Port Loko Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 5 years and 22 years. Two of her children are going to school.

Fatmata runs a used bag business within a busy market area. She sells different kinds of used clothes. She has been running this business since 1991. She works at the business throughout the week, 12 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is during the rainy season the slow purchasing power of customers.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more used clothing for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take good care of her family. In the future, she plans to open a used clothing and shoe shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing for resale

loans.name: Vallami

texts.ru: Валлами жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 64 лет. Он женат и имеет пятерых детей. Со своей семьёй Валлами живёт в маленьком посёлке. Он очень любит природу и животных, поэтому занимается видом бизнеса, который ему по душе. Валлами разводит скот, выращивает их и продаёт. Этот бизнес приносит ему стабильный доход. Жена Валлами  работает у себя дома занимается шитьем. А в свободное время она помогает мужу ухаживать за скотом. Дети Валлами уже взрослые и у них свои семьи, живут не далеко от родителей. Также Валлами имеет дополнительный доход, имеет строительный магазин где продает строительные материалы для местных жителей. У Валлами подрос  самый любимый внук и скоро внуку  нужно будет поступать в Университет для получения высшего образования. Поэтому сейчас Валлами желает увеличить свой бизнес, чтобы иметь достаточный доход для обеспечения своего внука. Он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит для покупки нескольких голов рогатого скота. Валлами надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Vallami is a cheerful 64 year old man. He is married and has five children. Vallami lives with his family in a small town. He loves nature and animals, so his line of work suits him. Vallami practices animal husbandry. He raises the animals and sells them. This business earns him a stable income. His wife works at home as a seamstress, and in her free time she helps her husband care for the animals. Vallami's children are grown, have their own children, and live far away. Vallami also has additional income because he has a hardware store where he sells building materials to locals. Vallami's beloved grandson is growing up fast and will soon need to go to a university for a higher education. With that in mind, Vallami wants to expand his business to earn more income to help with his son's education. He contacted Arvand and would like to obtain a loan to buy a few head of cattle. Vallami hopes for a positive response and thanks Arvand ahead of time for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо молодая замужняя женщина с одним ребенком. Ей 22 года. Она с мужем и дочерью живет у родителей мужа в районе Шахритуз. У них большая и дружная семья. Их семья состоит из 13 человек и каждый занят своим делом. Её муж работает в городе Душанбе.  Он сотрудник суда. Сама Мехринисо имеет среднее образование. Она не боится трудной работы. Мехринисо занимается  земледелием с юных лет. У нее очень богатый опыт в этой сфере. Еще она имеет дойную корову с теленком в своем домашнем хозяйстве. Сейчас Мехринисо намерена начать бизнес в области животноводства. Она хочет заняться куплей и продажей крупно-рогатого скота. С этой целью Мехринисо запрашивает кредит для закупа 5 голов бычков и их корма. Она ждет и надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Mehriniso is a young married woman with one child. She is 22 years old. She and her husband and daughter live with her husband's parents in the Shahrituz region. They are a large and loving family of 13 people, each with their own work. Her husband works in the city of Dushanbe as a shipping worker. Mehriniso herself has a high school education. She does not fear hard work. She has worked in agriculture from a young age, and has extensive experience in the area. Right now she has a milk cow with a calf on the family property but she would like to begin an animal husbandry business buying and selling cattle. With this goal in mind, she is asking for a loan to buy five head of cattle and their feed. She awaits and hopes for your support.

loans.use: buy five head of cattle and their feed

loans.name: Hanuman Self Help Group

texts.en: Hanuman Self Help Group is a group consisting of 11 members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they all were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start a grocery shop where they can provide the basic household consumables to their customers. One of them is Mrs. Santilata who was selected as their president. Santilata is a 52-year-old lady living with her husband and her only child who is working as a laborer in a company. The lady standing fifth from right wearing a yellow sari in the photo is Santilata. Her husband works as a laborer in a factory situated near her village. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers. For this reason, she has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

loans.use: to purchase toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Giringeswari Self Help Group

texts.en: The group Giringeswari Self Help Group (SHG) has nine members who are all from the same neighborhood. The lady standing fourth from the left, wearing a yellow sari in the photo is Tuni who is the leader of the group. Tuni is a 27-year-old woman married to a worker in Balipatna village in Odisha, India. The couple has two children who are in school. Tuni lives with her children and together with her husband takes care of all the household expenses. In order to help with all the family expenses, Tuni has been involved in doing paddy and vegetable cultivation and selling the harvest to distributors for the past three years. She supplies her paddy and rice to the rice dealers in the nearby market. In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Tuni and the group Giringeswari Self Help Group are requesting a loan from Peoples Forum to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and seeds and to cover their operational costs. Their goal is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds and to cover the operational costs of her paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is a farmer with 20 years of experience. He learned how to breed cattle when he was a little boy. Now when he has his own family with children and grandchildren, the farming business is the only source of income.

Together with his wife (in the photo), Samvel breeds cattle and cultivates wheat and potatoes.

The loan which Samvel is requesting will help him to acquire the farm inputs he needs to grow potatoes. He needs fertilizer and potato seeds. The loan will help him to have available everything he needs to carry out the cultivation process, gather more harvest and have a higher income.

Samvel works hard to improve his family's living conditions. He waits for your support!

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is a 49 year old conservative woman and she has asked her daughter to take her place in the photo.

Basma has 8 sons and daughters. One of them is Nour, a 22 year old single lady, she is a university student majoring in Accounting. Now Basma is applying for a loan to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.name: Eshmamat

texts.ru: Эшмамату 53 года. Он женат и отец пятерых детей. Эшмамат со своей семьей живет и работает в районе Руми. Его жена и дочь занимаются шитьем национальных платьев на дому. Сам Эшмамат занимается сельским хозяйством. У него достаточно хороший опыт в этой области. Он зарабатывает на жизнь за счет земледелия, который приносит ему его упорный труд. Эшмамат хочет одновременно заняться новым делом, так как его дети выросли и их нужно женить и обеспечивать жильем. Он планирует начать бизнес в сфере животноводства, а именно заняться куплей и продажей мелкого рогатого скота. С этой целью он обратился за кредитом. Он просит кредит для закупа овец, баранов и их корма. За счет прибыли он планирует женить своего одного сына.
texts.en: Eshmamat is 53 years old. He is married and the father of five children. Eshmamat and his family live and work in the Rumy region. His wife and daughter work at home tailoring traditional garments. Eshmamat himself is a farmer. He has experience in this area. He earns his living in farming by persistent work. He would like to run a new business concurrently, since his children are grown and he needs to marry them and provide them with housing. He plans to start an animal husbandry business, in particular, to buy and sell small livestock. With this goal in mind he is requesting a loan to buy sheep, rams, and their feed. He plans to use the income for the marriage of his one son.

loans.use: buy and sell small livestock

loans.name: Jahmison

texts.en:
Jahmison is a 29 year old retail shop owner in Kilifi, Kenya. He is a single man who supports two of his siblings and has been in this business for the last eight years and has done great.

This marks his fourth loan from KADET LTD, to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase a stock of cooking fat, bales of wheat and maize flour, sugar and milk for his shop and the anticipated profit will service his loan as well as pay school fee for his siblings. 

He hopes to open a butchery in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stock of cooking fat, bales of wheat and maize flour, sugar and milk for his shop

loans.name: Timur

texts.ru: Тимур целеустремленный человек в возрасте 30 лет. Он еще не женат и живет с матерью и бабушкой в городе Душанбе. У него среднее техническое образование. Тимур в течение последних 2-х лет работал сотрудником цеха по производству пластиковых окон. Он набрал достаточный опыт и теперь хочет начать свою предпринимательскую деятельность в этом направлении. Тимур уже арендовал здание на бессрочный срок и имеет сырье для производства. Однако ему еще необходимо закупить оборудование. Для реализации своей цели Тимур обратился за кредитом. Он просит кредит для приобретения оборудования по производству пластиковых окон и тем самым приступить к производственной деятельности.
texts.en:
Timur is a goal-oriented man of 30 years.  He is not married and he lives with his mother and grandmother in the city of Dushanbe.  He has a secondary level technical education.  For the last two years, Timur worked in a workshop that produces vinyl windows.  He has gained a good deal of experience and he now wants to start his own business in this field.  

Timur has already taken out an unlimited term lease on the building and he has the raw materials.  However, he still needs to buy the equipment.  In order to reach his goal and start his business, Timur has applied for a loan.  He is requesting the loan to acquire equipment for the production of vinyl windows and thereby begin production.

loans.use: to buy equipment for the production of vinyl windows

loans.name: Iram

texts.en: Iram is a 36-year-old married woman.  She has been running a business making  'samosa' for the past 10 years. Samosa is considered a traditional food specialty item in Pakistan. It is a fried or baked pastry with a savory filling, such as spiced potatoes, onions, peas, lentils or chicken. She makes it very well and then sells to the people of her community. She also takes orders from nearby hotels and makes enough to lead a decent life. In order to expand her business, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy a stock of flour and baking powder with packs of oil and salt at lower rates from the market. It would enable her to increase her sales, which ultimately helps in generating more cash. Iram wishes to use her earned profit on her children’s education and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking powder, oil and salt.

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Haja from Port Loko. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 6 years and 15 years. Her children are currently going to school. She was a housewife but her husband's income is not enough to support the home. 

Haja sells general store items at her house. She sells soap, milk, pure water, soda and biscuits. She has been running this business since 2011. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night.   Haja says that her business is going well because she started with a small loan amount through BRAC.

Haja has requested a loan in order to buy more soap, milk, pure water, and drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soap, milk, pure water, and drinks

loans.name: Mays

texts.en: Mays is a 26 year old conservative married lady. She has asked her husband who works as a taxi driver to appear in the photo instead. Mays is a certified hair dresser. She does use her certification to dress hair,  but she has also started a small retail business on the side selling clothes, perfume and accessories. Now Mays is applying for a youth loan to buy more accessories and a few make up products to sell.

loans.use: to buy more accessories and a few make up products to sell.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. He has 2 children and has been doing this work for 4 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Farming maize'. His biggest challenge is 'lack of capital.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Dhiang.'

Thomas was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'It offers financing to farmers.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'They gives loans to small-scale farmers.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Thomas replied 'Increased family income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Thomas owns the following: 'a cow, poultry, and a bicycle' but does not own 'a pig, a pump, a motorcycle, or an automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito netting' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD player'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk-producing area. He has 2 children and has been doing this work for 7 years. His primary income source is milk.

He said that what is most enjoyable about farming is, 'Watching  his cattle  grazing." His biggest challenge is 'Ecto-parasites control.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'leakina to mean white udder.'

Julius was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "Training on credit  management."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session to which he responded, "Proper record keeping."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?", Julius replied, "Milk for consumption and for sale."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Julius owns the following: a cow, poultry and a bicycle but he does not own  a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and solar power but does not have electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.
