He currently grows beans and corn and also raises livestock on a small scale. During the summer, he goes to work in Costa Rica, clearing land and cutting coffee and this enables him to get capital to invest in his crops. He hopes to get good produce to sell and to make an income that will enable him to invest and grow his harvest. He needs the loan to buy manure, fertilizers, and seeds to sow beans. His next goal is to sow 3 hectares of beans and pay back his loan.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, and seed to sow beans.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet, 37, is married and has a son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income by running a generel store in front of their house. 

She started this business seven years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages.

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan is 57 years old and married with three children.  He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City.  He and his wife earn an income running a general store in front of their house.  He started this business 14 years ago.  He sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in his community.  

Nhan is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of products.  In particular he is stocking his store with foods and beverages to better satisfy his customers.  He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages.

loans.name: Caaguazu Poty Group

texts.es:
Caaguazú Poty está en su ciclo 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde 2 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, esto es posible saber gracias a la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, la cual es una gran herramienta de ayuda para estas mujeres.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lourdes, quien a través de la venta de bijouterie y, también de su esfuerzo está creciendo poco a poco. Cuenta que hay muchos desafíos que se deben superar día a día, pero que ella se esfuerza por salir adelante y superarlos. Se define a sí misma como una persona muy emprendedora.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de lentejuelas, hilos, agujas, pinzas y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo bijouterie para seguir vendiéndolos y tener los ingresos que necesita.
texts.en:
Caaguazú Poty is in its seventh loan cycle in its women's committee, where two members are below the poverty line. This is possible to know thanks to the survey on eliminating poverty, which is a great tool to help these women.

One of the members is Lourdes, who works by selling jewelry and is slowly growing. She says that there are challenges that she must overcome every day, but she works to move forward and overcome them. She defines herself as a very enterprising person.

Lourdes is requesting this loan to buy sequins, thread, needles, clothespins, and other supplies to continue making and selling jewelry. This will provide her with necessary income.

loans.use: to buy sequins, thread, needles, clothespins, and other supplies to continue making jewelry

loans.name: Clavel Poty Group

texts.es:
14 mujeres muy trabajadoras de la ciudad de Caacupé se han unido con la esperanza de trabajar juntas y ayudar a sus familias por medio de ese esfuerzo, son mujeres jefas de familia, que conforme pasen los ciclos del programa de mujeres emprendedoras quieren mejorar su economía.
Tomaza, una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de varias clases de comestibles, cuenta que tiene buena cantidad de clientes que siempre compran de ella las delicias que hace. Al principio le costó un poco, pero que hoy ya se desenvuelve muy bien. Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ella y su familia reciben.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, jamón, queso y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas y deleitando a sus clientes con sus comestibles.
texts.en:
Fourteen very hardworking women from the city of Caacupé have united with the hope of working together and helping their families with their efforts. They are heads of household who as they go through the cycles of the enterprising women program want to improve their finances. 

Tomaza, one of the members, works selling several types of food. She has a good number of customers who always buy from her because of the delicious things she makes. At the beginning , it was a little difficult, but today it is going well. She is a very hardworking person and a fighter. She is grateful for this opportunity that she and her family are getting. She is asking for this loan to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, ham, cheese, and other ingredients to be able to keep selling and delighting her customers with her food.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, ham, cheese, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda es una mujer de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Nilda no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Chupe de Camarones para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Nilda trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende ropa interior, como trusas, bivirís, medias y otros, Nilda trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Nilda se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción para refaccionar el techado y cercar la parte trasera de su hogar, de esta manera ella y su familia tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus pequeños convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Nilda is a 37 year old woman who lives in the city of Camancá with her two little children who she loves and who are her principal reason for living. She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who puts all her efforts into moving her family ahead as she is both father and mother to her children. Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources and because she had to work from a young age, Nilda was not able to study a professional degree. In her free time she likes to watch movies and sometimes to cook a delicious shrimp chowder called Chupe de Camarones to share with her family. 
On her own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, Nilda runs a small clothes store selling underwear such as briefs, panties, stockings, and other things. Nilda works every day for about 10 hours and believes that she is doing well because of her good prices and for the friendly attention that she gives to others. 
Nilda is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help they have offered, she will be able to make improvements to her home as she needs to buy construction materials to repair the roof and to enclose the yard. In this way, she and her family will have more security and wellbeing and she will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of seeing her little ones become good professionals.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 46-year-old married woman who lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a driver for hire.  For six years, she has run a food stall selling soft drinks for people in her community.

She would like a loan to purchase a greater quantity of beverages.  She hopes this will enable her to meet the needs of her customers and to attract additional customers.  She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 48 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Musu is a widow. She did not go to shchool and has two children who are 15 and 13 years old. Both children are in school and live at home. For the past 5 years, she has been selling soft drinks and cool water. She transports her goods by motor bike. She started this business with a little bit of help from her friends. She learned this business from them. She likes her business because of the ways that people respond to it. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. She hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Rosa Margoth

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 61 años que creció en un hogar de escasos recursos por lo que pudo educarse hasta terminar la escuela primaria y luego ayudar en los quehaceres del hogar y del campo junto  a sus padres. Se casó muy joven con Efren  que actualmente tiene 57 años y se dedica a la agricultura, con él salió de la ciudad en la que creció; para ir a una zona con clima cálido donde nacieron sus 6 hijos; 5 de los cuales son independientes, trabajan y tienen su familia, el hijo menor está a punto de terminar la escuela primaria y Rosa vive con él y su esposo en Río Verde de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una ciudad que cuenta un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Sus varios atractivos turísticos acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Rosa con el objetivo de aportar en los gastos del hogar, desde hace 7 años emprendió con el negocio de crianza de pollos para su posterior comercialización, actividad que la aprendió de uno de sus parientes quien compartió todos los conocimientos del negocio para que Rosa también lo pusiera en práctica. Rosa invierte todas las mañanas en el aseo, alimentación y cuidado de los pollos y a veces algún tiempo en las tardes, paralelamente a esto, ella realiza los quehaceres del hogar para no despreocuparse de las necesidades de su esposo e hijo. Rosa firma que para este negocio siempre es necesario proveerse de capital para comprar “balanceado” que es el alimento especial que se da a las aves y además para comprar pollos bebé para criarlos y luego venderlos; es por esto que por cuarto año consecutivo, ella ha solicitado un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de algunos pollos adicionales y además balanceado al por mayor para tener la provisión de alimento necesaria para los pollos que tiene y los que vendrán. Rosa ha sido una cliente puntual en sus cuotas y ha continuado trabajando con Fundación Alternativa porque el trato que recibe en la oficina y de su ejecutivo de cuenta es motivador. Rosa agradece  a todas las personas alrededor dl mundo que aún sin conocerla deciden confiar en ella y su microempresa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 61 years old.  She grew up in a household with limited resources, so she was only able to attend school through primary school and later helped her parents with the household chores and in the fields.  She got married very young to Efren, who is 57 years old and works as a farmer.  With him, she left the city where she was born to go to an area with a warm climate where their six children were born.  Five of them are now independent and have their own families and the youngest is about to finish primary school.  Rosa lives with him and her husband in Rio Verde in Santo Domingo, the capital of the Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas province.  The city has a significant amount of trade since it has become a land port for exchange between the mountain and coastal regions of the country.  Its various tourist attractions, in addition to its warm climate, are frequented by national and international tourists.  The majority of the inhabitants have learned a commercial trade or provide services to the locals and tourists.

Seven years ago, with the objective of helping with the household expenses, Rosa started a business raising chickens for later sale.  She learned this work from one of her relatives who shared their knowledge of the business so that Rosa could also put it into practice.  Rosa spends her mornings and sometimes afternoons cleaning, feeding, and caring for the chickens.  At the same time, she does the household chores so that she does not have to worry about the needs of her husband and son.  

Rosa says that for her business it is always necessary to have capital to purchase "balanceado", which is the special feed that is given to poultry, as well as chicks to raise them and later sell.  This is why for the fourth consecutive year, she has requested a loan to invest in the purchase of additional chickens and feed at wholesale prices.  This allows her to have the necessary feed for the chickens she has and those she will sell.  

Rosa has been a punctual customer with her repayments and has continued working with Fundacion Alternative because of the treatment she receives in the office and her account manager is motivating.  Rosa is grateful to all of the people around the world who decided to trust her and her small business without knowing her.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
El Sr. Derlis vive en pareja hace 6 años con la señora Nimia, con quien tiene un hijo, por quien ambos luchan incansablemente para poder darle a su hijo una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Derlis cuenta que anteriormente trabajaba en la Argentina como albañil y tras un esfuerzo de 5 años  pudo comprar una casa propia y abrir para su despensa  en la compañía rural donde vive para poder radicarse nuevamente en Paraguay. Su mayor anhelo siempre fue contar con un negocio propio donde pueda trabajar toda la familia.
Ahora cuenta con una surtida despensa hace aproximadamente 2 años y cuenta que le está yendo muy bien y está muy feliz de volver a su país y a su ciudad y por sobre todo estar con su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos enlatados, bebidas de todo tipo, verduras, frutas y demás para poder surtir su negocio. Es un señor con personalidad innovadora y progresista y por supuesto luchadora.
texts.en:
Derlis lives with his spouse of 6 years, Nimia. They have one son. They both fight tirelessly to be able to  give their son a dignified life that lacks for nothing. 

Derlis says that he used to work in Argentina as a bricklayer and after 5 years was able to buy his own house and open a store in the rural area where he lives to be able to live in Paraguay again. His biggest wish was always to have his own business where his whole family can work. Now he has had a store for approximately 2 years and he says that it is going well for him and he is very happy to be back in his country and above all to be with his family. 

He is asking for this loan to invest it in canned products, in all types of beverages, vegetables, fruits and more for his business. He is a man with a innovative and progressive personality, and of course he is a fighter.

loans.use: to buy canned products, all types of beverages, vegetables, fruits, and more.

loans.name: Ut

texts.en: Ut is 44 years old and is married.  He has a daughter and lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City.  His wife runs a food stall.  Ut has run a shop to repair scooters for 3 years.  He intends to use his loan to buy many kinds of spare parts to meet his customers' demands.  He hopes his business runs smoothly to help improve his family's living conditions and to save money for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his shop.

loans.name: Shem

texts.en:
Shem lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana-growing region.  He has 4 children and has been doing this work for 10 years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and crops.  Shem enjoys dairy farming and his biggest challenge is insufficient capital and limited market.  Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyangera.'

Shem was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, “training on farming and interest is favorable”.  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, to which he replied, “the more you save the more money you get”.  His highest monthly expense is school fees.  When asked “how will this loan benefit his family”,  Shem replied “paying school fees”.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated.  Shem owns a cow, pig, and poultry but does not own a pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile.  Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan.  This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and sewing machine but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and to send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mable has five children who are all in school. She is a resident of Kigyende, a suburb in Isingiro district. She married at 18 to a man she loved. But later, the husband deserted his family and moved to Tanzania. Unfortunately the family had no income-generating business except for a small banana plantation which was the source of food for the family.  Mable struggled for the survival of her children. 

She then contacted Ugafode Microfinance and acquired a loan of 2,000,000 UGX that helped her expand and improve the plantation. Because of her hard work, her business developed and now supports her family as well as a commercial house which increases her family income. She is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 UGX to complete the house and to pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase building materials.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc, 35, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a business of selling gas tanks and gas cookers for seven years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more different products of gas and gas cookers to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more different products of gas and gas cookers to sell.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.fr:
Augustin est le troisième boutiquier partenaire à l’entreprise sociale Nafa Naana à être installé dans la ville de Ouagadougou pour la distribution de produits énergie. Les produits sont des foyers améliorés, à gaz et des lampes solaires. En plus des produits ordinaires de la quincaillerie et boutique qu’il proposait à la population de son quartier Bissighin, localité non électrifiée et située à la périphérie de la ville de Ouagadougou, Augustin pourra acheter et revendre 10 foyers améliorés, 5 foyers à gaz et 14 lampes solaires grâce à ce prêt dont le montant est de 348 750 FCFA. Notons que les moyens financiers d’Augustin ne lui permettent pas d’assurer l’acquisition de ces nouveaux produits pourtant importants pour lui et la population de son quartier. La revente de ces équipements procurera un revenu supplémentaire pour le boutiquier. Egalement ses clients pourront réaliser des économies contribuant ainsi à l’amélioration de leurs conditions de vie. Enfin Augustin participera à la protection de l’environnement.  

A 47 ans, marié et père de trois enfants dont deux sont en situation scolaire, il rêve de devenir un grossiste et de pouvoir vendre davantage des produits solaires (le solaire de grande dimension, frigos solaires) pour soulager les populations de son quartier.
texts.en:
Augustin is the third shopkeeper-partner at the social enterprise Nafa Naana to be set up in Ouagadougou City for distributing energy products. The products are improved stoves, gas stoves, and solar lamps. In addition to common hardware and shop goods he has been offering to people in his district of Bissighin, a  place lacking electricity located on the outskirts of Ouagadougou City, Augustin will be able to buy and resell 10 improved stoves, 5 gas stoves, and 14 solar lamps, thanks to this loan in the amount of 348,750 francs CFA. 

Note that Augustin's financial means do not ensure he can acquire these new yet important products for him and for the people of his district. Selling this equipment will bring in additional revenues for the shopkeeper. His customers will also be able to save money, thus helping to improve their living conditions. In the end, Augustin will help to protect the environment. 

At 47 years of age, married, and a father of three children, of whom two are in school, he dreams of becoming a wholesaler and being able to sell more solar products (large-scale solar, solar refrigerators) in order to bring relief to the people of his district.

loans.use: to trade in improved stoves, gas stoves, and solar lamps

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme de 51ans. Elle est mariée à un retraité et mère de famille. Elle est revendeuse de pure water (eau minérale mise en sachet) depuis 1997. Elle est à son premier crédit et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter plus d’eau minérale. Elle veut récréer une autre activité (ouverture d’une boutique d’alimentation générale) et assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants.
texts.en: Afi is a 51-year-old woman who is married to a retiree. She is a mother with a family and has been selling 'pure water' (mineral water in plastic pouches) since 1997. She is on her first loan and is requesting it to purchase more mineral water. She wants to create another business (a grocery store) and to ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase 'pure water' to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 30-year-old single woman. She has three children, ranging from two to 10 years old. She describes herself as ambitious. Agnes operates a grocery where she sells kale, cabbages, onions and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Agnes will use the 5,000 KES loan to purchase more onions to add to her stock. Her business goal is to supply vegetables to institutions within five years. She describes her biggest business challenge as transportation. She hopes for a stable business and family in the future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase more onions to sell in her grocery.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 49-year-old single woman who lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.  She has run a general store in front of her door for 30 years.  She started this business to cover her living expenses.  She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more food and many kinds of soft drinks to sell from her store.  She hopes that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in the future.

loans.use: to buy food and many kinds of soft drinks.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a 38-year-old resident of the Ndaija village in the Mbarara district.  He is married with 6 children and 2 dependents from his uncle who died 4 years ago.  All of his children and dependents are in school.  He dropped out of school after primary seven, due to lack of school fees, and he started to work as a porter at the nearby sites.  With his little accumulated savings, he started a small retail shop for survival.  This has enabled him to look after his family as well as to pay tuition for the children.  He has also managed to construct a residential house to accommodate his family.  

He is requesting 2,500,000 to complete the residential house in order to give his family enough space and decent accommodations to take on even some relatives.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to complete his residential house.

loans.name: San Cayetano 1 Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano 1 es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, está integrado por 21 mujeres muy trabajadoras, que luchan por sus familias, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para saber la situación integral de cada una de las miembros.
Catalina es parte de este luchador grupo, en su última encuesta de eliminación de pobreza resulto estar en el nivel uno, es decir con niveles de ingresos muy bajos. Ella es una persona con muchas ansias de crecer, lo cual se ve muy bien con el entusiasmo que pone. Ella se dedica a la venta de leche, y cuenta que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día para poder llevar su producto a la mesa de sus clientes para el desayuno.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de más leche, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas. Ella esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le ayudará a invertir en su microemprendimientos y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The group San Cayetano 1, in the city of Coronel Oviedo, is made up of 21 very hardworking women who fight for their families. They are part of the Poverty Elimination Survey that looks at the overall situation of each one of the members.

Catalina is part of this group of fighters. In her last poverty elimination survey she was a level one - that is to say, with a very low level of income. She has a great desire to grow, which shows in her enthusiasm. She sells milk, starting work very early in the day so that she can get her product on her customers' tables for breakfast. 

She asks for a loan to buy more milk so that she can continue her sales. She is grateful for the opportunity that she has been given since it will help her to invest in her small business and have more income.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married with seven children. Alma is 42 years old, residing in Malaubang, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

Alma has spent seven years in her business venture of selling snack foods like banana cue to earn a living. Aside from vending, she also manages seaweed cultures, planting and harvesting seaweed to sell. Recently, she borrowed an amount of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase seedlings and twine for the seaweed cultures.

In the future, Alma wants to improve her house and see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and twine for seaweed cultures.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 46 years old and married with five children.  She lives in La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

She is currently doing business  with Avon, and she is the stockholder of the area. After joining GDMPC last year, she gained access to micro finance and recently borrowed PHP 50,000.00 to be used as additional capital to procure more cosmetics to sell. 

She wants to see her children become successful in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products.

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 47-year-old widow who lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For years she has managed her coconut farm business. She also has planted bananas in the farm, which helps her a lot, for it gives her additional income. Recently, she requested a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from the cooperative to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

Rosemarie plans to use her profits to cultivate the farm in order to gain an abundant harvest. She is planning to repair her house to create a more conducive place in which to work and live.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 38 years old and lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.   She is married and has completed 12th grade.  Vivian has four children between seven and 18 years old, all of whom are living at home and are in school.

Vivian works as a security guard, and also owns a shop located in front of their house. The shop is run by her younger sister and they have owned it for the past five years.  She started it with a little money from her husband, and has learned the business from her friends. She enjoys her shop because of the ways people respond to it. 

Vivian is requesting a loan to purchase more goods such as flour, sugar, oil, milk, vita, salt and onion to sell in her shop. She hopes to earn more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as flour, sugar, oil, milk, vita, salt and onion to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao, 38, is married and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a general store in front of their house. 

She started this business five years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular, foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 42 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, which is located by the sea and is the capital city of Grand Bassa County. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Cecelia is married. She did not go to school and has five children between 21 and 15 years old. Only one lives at home and is in school. For the past thirteen years, she has been selling flour, rice, bread, sugar, etc. in the local market. She started this business with money from her husband, and she learned this business from her friends. She likes her business because of the ways people respond to it.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, rice, bread, sugar, etc. for her business. Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, rice, bread, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Zulfunun

texts.ru:
Зулфунун женщина 36 лет.Замужем мать троих прекрасных детей. Сама Зулфунун родилась и выросла в сельской местности. Зулфунун человек радостный, трудолюбивый и у неё очень много друзей. Зулфунун из тех числа людей которые протягивают руку тем которые нуждаются в помощи. Хобби Зулфунун  ухаживание за цветами. 
В 2007 году Зулфунун начала заниматься торговлей . Начала торговлю с парфюмерии.  Несмотря на то что все  её время  уходило на рынке, она также  старалась   заниматься   домашним хозяйством.    Муж Зулфунун мастер. Это работа мужа сезонная и Зулфунун всячески старается помогать мужу.  Зулфунун вот уже 6 лет как занимается торговлей и хорошо изучила рыночную экономику. Зулфунун изучает рынок смотрит какой и на что идёт спрос. Проанализировав доход меняет вид торговли. В данное время Зулфунун продаёт женскую одежду. В летний сезон она хочет приумножить ассортимент. Но для этого у неё недостаточно средств и в связи с этим она обратилась за кредитом в организацию Арванд.   Зулфунун надеется на поддержку и заранее благодарит Арванд.
texts.en: Zulfunun is a 36 year old woman. She is a married mother of three beautiful children. Zulfunun was born and grew up in the countryside. She is a cheerful person, who is hardworking, and has many friends. Zulfunun is the kind of person who lends a helping hand. Her hobby is growing flowers. In 2007 Zulfunun began her business. She began to trade perfume. Despite the fact that all of her time was spent at the market, she tries to do housework. Zulfunun's husband is the head of the household. Her husband's work is seasonal and Zulfunun tries to help him every way she can. Zulfunun has been trading for six years already and knows the market economy well. Zulfunun studies what the market is looking for and what is in demand. After analyzing potential income she changes what she trades. At this time Zulfunun sells women's clothing. In the summer season she wants to multiply her assortment. But for this she does not have enough money so she applied for a loan from Avand. Zulfunun hopes for support and is thankful to Avand in advance.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing.

loans.name: Flaminio

texts.es:
El Sr.  Flaminio tiene  26 años de edad,  es un joven soltero vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, tiene 6 hermanos, quienes trabajan y ayudan a sus padres.
El Sr. Flaminio  es mecánico desde los 18  años, comenta que desde pequeño fue ayudando y hoy ya tiene su taller de motos en el casa de sus padres, se siente muy orgulloso por sus logros, comenzó a independizarse desde muy joven y así lograr todas sus metas. Con esta activad pudo estudiar y conseguir realizar inversiones de un terreno propio en la ciudad donde vive en donde a futuro quiere formalizar su relación con su novia. Está muy contento con la oportunidad  que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya con el crédito, de esta manera podrá crecer en su negocio.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de un compresor, con el cual podrá seguir trabajando y dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Flaminio is 26 years old, single and lives with his parents in the city of Coronel Oviedo. He has six siblings, who work and help their parents. Flaminio has been a mechanic for 18 years, saying that he has helped out since he was little. Today he already has a motorcycle repair shop in his parents' home, and he feels very proud of his achievements. He started working on his own from a very young age and has been able to reach all of his goals. With this work he was able to study and make an investment into a plot land in the city where he lives, where he hopes to start a family with his girlfriend in the future. He is very pleased with the opportunity for a loan through Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya, and in this way he will be able to grow his business. He is requesting the loan to purchase a compressor, with which he will be able to continue working and provide a good service to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor for his repair shop.

loans.name: Elaine

texts.en:
Elaine is a married, 43-year-old woman who stopped her education in the 11th grade.  She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, which is cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.  

Elaine has three children between the ages of 22 and 17 years old.  Only one is in school and lives at home.  For the past three years she has been selling used clothes.  She started this business with a little amount from her aunty, and she learned this business from her.  She likes her business because of the ways in which people respond to it.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.  Her dream is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mi

texts.en:
Mi is 44 years old and married with two children, a son and a daughter.  Mi and her husband have been running a food stall to sell noodles in front of her door for 10 years.  She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children.  She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more noodles and ingredients to sell for her customers.  She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business.  She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have enough money to reinvest for the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles and ingredients.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh, 37, is married with two children, a son and a daughter. He and his wife support their family with a general store that sells beer, soft drinks and other household items to people in his community. 

Thanh is requesting a loan to expand his business by purchasing a greater variety of products to sell, in particular food and beverages, to better satisfy his customers. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of food and beverages to stock in his store.

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en:
Tuyen is 41 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn their income by running a food stall that sells meals, soft drinks and coffee to people in their community.

Tuyen started her business eight years ago. With the loan, she will buy a variety of different foods and furniture for her stall and gradually expand her business. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of food and new furniture for her stall.

loans.name: Phung

texts.en:
Phung is 60 years old and is divorced. She lives with her son in Ho Chi Minh City.  She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business eight years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular, foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 49-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn money by running a food stall to sell hot-pots for people in their community.

Hong would like a loan to purchase a better quality of raw food, such as meat and vegetables, and new furniture for her stall. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality of raw food, such as meat and vegetables, and furniture for her stall.

loans.name: Rosalie Célestine

texts.fr: Rosalie est une femme de 55 ans commerçante dans un marché de la capitale depuis 17 ans. Elle vend de la friperie et compte tenue de la petitesse de son capital elle se sent obligée de se rendre au marché tous les samedi pour un triage de vêtements ce qui ne rapporte pas grand chose. A présent elle veut acheter un ballot de friperie pour enfants pour diversifier ses produits. Ceci lui permettra de  renforcer sa notoriété en tant que seule frippière de ce petit marché.le bénéfice qui en resultera lui permettra de construire son propre local qui lui permettra un stockage aisé de sa marchandise.
texts.en: Rosalie is a 55-year old woman who has been working as a vendor at one of the capital’s city’s markets for 17 years. She sells used clothing. Given her small capital, she is forced to go to the market every Saturday to sort out merchandise, and thus her business does not bring in much. At present she would like to buy a bale of used clothing for children in order to diversify her offerings. This will allow her to bolster her business reputation as she is the only used clothing vendor at that small market. The resulting revenues will allow her to build her own store which will allow her to stock her merchandise more easily.

loans.use: to buy a bale of children's clothing.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es:
El  Sr. Bernardino es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 39 años, está casado con la Sra. Maura de 34 años. Tienen 2 hijos pequeños, que van a la escuela, y por quienes luchan, ya que quieren que el día de mañana sean personas de bien y que tengan estudios para progresar.
El tiene  una frutería y verdulería en el Mercado, ocupa dos puestos de trabajo, y comenta que tiene una clientela formada, lo que le da un buen ingreso. Es un señor muy trabajador, excelente cliente. Comenta que además tiene una camioneta en la que hace repartos.
El solicita de este crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras para poder seguir con su venta y generando los ingresos para ayudar y dar a su familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Bernardino, 39, is from the city of Santaní city and is married to Maura, 34. They have two young children who go to school, and they fight for their children's future because they want them to become good people and to be able to study to progress in life.

Bernardino has a fruit and vegetable business at the local market, and he has two stalls. He says that he has many regular customers, which gives him a good income. He is a very hardworking gentleman, with excellent customers. Bernardino also owns a van which he uses to make deliveries.

He has requested this loan to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables, in order to continue his business and generate revenue to help his family and and give them what they need.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell on his stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Mashauri Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mihako est leader du groupe de crédit « Mashauri », entrepreneur courageuse et expérimentée, âgée de 44 ans et mère de 10 enfants. Son conjoint est un évangéliste, serviteur de Dieu. La cliente est vendeuse de friperie. Elle commença cette activité avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  1 ballon de friperie. La crise économique généralisée suite aux effets de la guerre est un obstacle majeur pour le développement de son activité. Dans le futur, elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise, construire une maison et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit aux femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en: This client, Mihako, is the lead of the loan group "Mashauri". A courageous and experienced entrepreneur, she is 44 years old and a mother of ten. Her husband is an evangelist, a servant of God. This client sells secondhand clothing. She started this business with funds from her husband. This new loan will be used to purchase a bale of used clothing. A major obstacle in developing her business is the generalized economic crisis following the war. For the future, she would like to expand her enterprise, build a house, and provide education for her children. So, she thanks Hekima for its micro-credit support of women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of secondhand clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est constitué de six femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames à Djalakorodji, une des quartiers périphérique de la commune  de Kati. Elles ont en moyenne 50 ans et 7 enfants. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djalakorodji. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de jus à base d’oseilles de Guinée ou de gingembre, de Condiments (cubes magies, ail, soumbala,…). Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sitan femme assise à l’extrême gauche est une grande vendeuse de jus locaux. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 sac de sucre, 100 kg de gingembre, 100kg d’oseille de guinée et des essences. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Bamako. Pour faire des jus, on broie le gingembre, l’imbibe dans l’eau avant de le décanter puis on ajoute le sucre, les essences et l’eau. Ce mélange est réparti dans des bidons ou sachets plastics prêt pour la vente qui est faite  au comptant  au marché  à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Elle espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et subvenir aux besoins de leur famille.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi is composed of married women for the most part in monogamous families in Djalakorodji, an outlying district of Commune de Kati. The women average 50 years of age and seven children each. They know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses at the Djalakorodji market. The group members have small-scale businesses selling juice drinks made from hibiscus flowers or ginger, as well as selling condiments (Magie bouillon cubes, garlic, 'soumbala', …) With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Sitan, who is the woman sitting at the far left in the photo, is a major vendor of local juice drinks. She intends to use her loan to purchase a bag of sugar, 100 kg of ginger, 100 kg of hibiscus flowers, and some flavorings. She gets her supplies at the big market in Bamako. 

To make juice drinks, the ginger is crushed and soaked in water and allowed to settle, and then sugar, flavorings, and water are added. This mixture is apportioned among drums or plastic pouches ready for sale. Sales are made in cash at the market to a customer base composed mostly of women. 

With this loan, she hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in business and providing for her family.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for making juice drinks

loans.name: Nancee

texts.en: Nancee is 39 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu (cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce). Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. Nancee is single. She completed Grade 12 before establishing her business seven years ago selling cosmetics such as body cream, bath soap, body spray, roll-on, etc. She started this business with a little money from her mother, and she learned the business from her. She likes how people respond to her business and, mostly, she enjoys the interactions with her customers. She spends eight hours on her business, six days a week. Nancee is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics such as body cream, bath soap, body spray, roll-on, etc., for her business. She hopes to make more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, such as body cream, bath soap, body spray, roll-on, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung is 54 years old and is married. He has a daughter and a son and lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife have run a food stall at their house for six years. They sell meals and sugar-cane juice for people in their community. He intends to use his loan to buy better-quality ingredients and food to make better meals for selling.

Hung hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and save money for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy better-quality ingredients and food to make meals.

loans.name: Tiessiri  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe TIESSIRI  II sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Nianguela Socoro, un des villages de la région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres Culture de l’arachide, du riz et du haricot. Elles sont à leur première  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, KONIBA la première personne à droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 2 Ha de riz d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Beleco, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice 150 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "TIESSIRI  II" are married women averaging 37 years of age and five children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Nianguela Socoro, a village in Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their work better at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown include peanuts, rice, and beans. The women are in their first collaboration with the institution.

With this loan, KONIBA, who is the first person sitting from the right in the photo, intends to purchase farm inputs and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing for maintaining about 2 hectares of rice, peanuts, and beans.

After the harvest, the produce is sold in Beleco City to a customer base composed of men and women. She envisions making a profit of about 150,000 francs CFA per planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, herbicide, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Be

texts.en: Be is requesting a new loan to buy many kinds of cakes and foods to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that with this loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of cakes and foods to sell

loans.name: Kaaguy Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Kaaguy Poty es de la Ciudad de Santaní se encuentra en el 3º ciclo y está integrado por 15 señoras. Ellas quieren invertir este crédito en los microemprendimientos de cada una, para poder ir creciendo y mejorando.
La Señora Josefina, es una de las integrantes, se dedica a la venta de Carne Vacuna, empezó solo con venta de carne de cerdo, pero con el crédito que se le otorgo en otros ciclos, pudo juntar mas plata y compro vaca para faenar y vender, cada día va creciendo más y planea tener en un futuro muy próximo una pequeña carnicería.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de animales para la faena, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y poco a poco seguir creciendo y estar más cerca de su sueño.
texts.en: The Kaaguy Poty group is from the city of Santaní, consists of 15 members and is in its third loan cycle. Each one of the women want to invest this loan in their small businesses so they can continue growing and improving. One of the members, Josefina, makes a living selling beef. She started out only selling pork, but with a previous loan along with more money, she was able to purchase a cow to butcher and sell. Every day she keeps growing more and plans in the very near future to have a small butcher's shop. She is requesting the loan to be able to invest in the purchase of animals to butcher, and in this way she will be able to continue making sales and growing her business little by little so she can be closer to her dream.

loans.use: to purchase animals.

loans.name: To

texts.en: To would like to take out a further loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of materials to make ornaments to sell from her stall. To's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that with this loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of materials to make ornaments, such as paper, glue and bamboo frames.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Nueva Esperanza está en su ciclo número 4to del programa de comité de mujeres,  donde cada una está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer e invertir en el trabajo de cada una. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una.
Virginia, una de ellas, se dedica a la venta de pescado, ella cuenta que esta yéndole muy bien en su trabajo, ya que el pescado es muy pedido en la zona de la ciudad donde ella trabaja. Comenta también que por medio de sus ventas ayuda a su familia y les da para cubrir sus necesidades. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que desde tempranas horas empieza su día y de esa manera se sacrifica.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de más pescados para la venta, ya que quiere surtirse y tener una buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group Nueva Esperanza is in their 4th cycle with the Women's Committee program, where each one is giving it their all to be able to grow and invest in their respective work. They are part of the poverty elimination survey that assesses each person's situation.

Virginia sells fish. She says that it's going very well, since fish is in high demand in the area of the city where she works. She comments that through her sales she helps her family to cover their necessities. She is hardworking, beginning her day very early and making that sacrifice for her work. 

She asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of more fish for sale, since she wants to stock up and have a good variety to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh would like to take out a further loan to repair her stall and buy food and meat to sell from her stall. Hanh's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that with this loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her stall and buy food and meat to sell.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Villa Bonita Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Emprendedoras de Villa Bonita está en su ciclo número 9º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de ellas se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Maria es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, comenta que se dedica a ser manicurista, es una persona muy buena en lo que hace, y gracias a eso ya tiene muy buena clientela. Cuenta que le gustaría poder crecer y el día de mañana tener un salón de belleza donde ampliar su servicio.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de esmaltes, acetona, limas, tijeras y demás para poder seguir prestando el buen servicio para sus clientes. Esta muy agradecida por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en: The Emprendedoras de Villa Bonita group is a collection of working women in their ninth loan cycle. In doing a survey on eliminating poverty, two of the members fell below the poverty line, meaning they have very little income. Maria is a very hardworking person and makes a living as a manicurist. She is very good at what she does, and thanks to this she has a very good customer base. She says that she would like to be able to grow her business and one day have a beauty salon where she can expand her service. She is requesting the loan to purchase nail polish, nail polish remover, files, scissors and other items she needs to be able to continue providing a good service to her customers. She is very grateful for this opportunity, which will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, nail polish remover, files, scissors and other items.

loans.name: Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mburucuya se encuentra en ciclo 12, en donde están trabajando de manera conjunta, están muy unidas y todas con actitud de querer salir adelante motivo por el cual solicitan el préstamo para poder concretar sus proyectos, están con muchas expectativas positivas y con ganas de crecer.
Maria, una de ellas, se dedica a la venta de carbón, cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que el carbón ha crecido en la venta, ya que es más económico y la gente lo compra mas. Comenta también que su familia la apoya en su trabajo, y que de esa forma están creciendo.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carbón, para poder seguir creciendo y trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: The Mburucuya group is in its 12th loan cycle, and all of the members are very united in working together so that everyone has an attitude to want to make headway. The members are requesting the loan to be able to carry out their projects and have a lot of positive expectations and desires to grow. One of the members, Maria, makes a living selling charcoal and says she has a very good customer base since her sales have increased, which lowers the price so people buy more of it. She also says her family supports her in her work, and in this way they are growing. Maria is requesting the loan to purchase charcoal so she can continue working and growing like she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Pojoasa Group

texts.es:
Pojoasa  está en el 6to ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo muy emprendedor y que fueron creciendo de a poco, son todas las señoras muy emprendedoras y quieren avanzar para un mejor porvenir de su familia.
Una persona digna de destacar es Liboria, quien se dedica a las ventas, ella tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida, en la cual trabaja día a día desde muy tempranas horas, ya que tiene muy buena clientela. Su sueño es poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para no tener que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidad como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Solicita de esta ayuda a Kiva y fundación paraguaya para poder surtir su negocio con productos de diversa clase, como ser leche, azúcar, panificados, verduras, frutas y demás.
texts.en: The Pojoasa group is in its sixth loan cycle. This group consists of enterprising women who want to make progress to better provide for their families. One person of note is Liboria, who makes a living selling items at her small general store. She works every day from very early in the morning and has a very good customer base. Her dream is to be able to give her family everything it needs so it doesn't go through the hard times she had to go through. She is requesting help from Kiva and partner Fundación Paraguaya in order to be able to stock her business with a range of products like milk, sugar, baked goods, vegetables, fruits and other items.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, baked goods, vegetables, fruits and other items.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Maria Auxiliadora  está en su ciclo número uno  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas, asistiendo a las capacitaciones y poniendo todo de sí. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Venancia es una de estas mujeres, quien a través de su trabajo y sacrificio esta creciendo y saliendo adelante y generando los ingresos para ir ayudando a su familia. Cuenta que se dedica a la venta de carbón, negocio en el que esta creciendo poco a poco, y ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carbón para la venta, ya que quiere poder tener una buena cantidad de producto que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group Maria Auxiliadora is in their first cycle with the Women's Committee program. They are learning to work together, attending the trainings and giving all of themselves. They are part of the poverty elimination survey, assessing the situation of each individual. 

Venancia is one of the women who, through her work and sacrifice, is growing and getting ahead and generating income to help her family. She sells charcoal, a business that is growing little by little, and she now has good customers. 

She asks for this loan to invest in the purchase of charcoal to sell, since she wants to have a large enough quantity of her product on hand to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien, 55, is married and widowed. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City.

Lien started a general store eight years ago. She sells sugar, spices, fast foods, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular, food and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa tiene 42 años, es casada tiene 3 hijos que trabajan y estudian. Ella se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa y venta de ropas usadas que trae del Brasil, trabaja muy bien, y cuenta que su  esposo trabaja en la  jardinería y realiza trabajos en varios domicilios en Asunción, San Lorenzo y otras ciudades.
Gracias al trabajo que están  haciendo pueden mantenerse y ayudar a la educación de sus hijos. La Sra.  ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta con sus compromisos. Solicita este crédito para utilizarlo en la compra de bebidas, fideos, arroz, azúcar, yerba, carne, frutas y demás para la despensa y también para comprar ropas usadas. Agradece por la  oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Teresa is 42 years old, married and has three children who work and are in school. She makes a living in commerce, since she has a convenience store and sells used clothing brought from Brazil. She does good work and says that her husband is a gardener who works at various homes in Asunción, San Lorenzo and other cities. Thanks to their work they have been able to take care of themselves and help pay for their children's education. Teresa has shown herself to be very responsible and honest with her promises. She is requesting the loan to purchase beverages, noodles, rice, sugar, herbs, meat, fruits and other items for her store, and also buy used clothing. She is grateful for this opportunity, which will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, noodles, rice, sugar, herbs, meet, fruits and other items, as well as purchase used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддасу 29 лет. Она разведена, имеет маленького ребенка и живет у матери вместе с братьями и невесткой в Шахритусском районе. Вначале Мукаддас было трудно справиться с тем, что ее семейная жизнь не сложилась. Но затем при поддержке родных, близких и самое главное благодаря ребенку ей удалось справиться с кризисом. Сейчас Мукаддас хочет начать свое дело. Она намеревается заняться торговым бизнесом. На рынке района у них имеется торговая точка, где раньше торговал ее брат. В данный момент брат Мукаддас находится в России на заработках и отдал это место ей. Мукаддас обратилась за кредитом, чтобы закупить товар. Она планирует заняться продажей детских одежд и надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Mukaddas is 29 years old. She is divorced, has a young child, and lives with her mother, brothers, and sister-in-law in the Shahrituz region. In the beginning it was difficult for Mukaddas to deal with her family life. But in the end, because of her family, friends, and most importantly because of her child she was able to cope with the crisis. Now Makaddas wants to start a business. She intends to start a trading business. In the market she has a trading point, where her brother used to trade. At this time Mukaddas' brother is in Russia working and sending his earnings back to her. Mukaddas applied for a loan so that she may purchase products. She plans to begin selling children's clothing and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: 1 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El comité “1 de mayo” pasa al 7mo ciclo. Todas las integrantes cuentan con actividades económicas independientes. Es un grupo muy trabajador, que es de la ciudad de Santaní, las integrantes del grupo son de zonas bastante alejadas, donde no tienen facilidad de acceso a ciertos medios.
En su mayoría son mujeres rurales, una de ellas es Sonia, quien se dedica a la cría, venta o faena de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, vacas, cabras y demás. Cuenta que es un trabajo sacrificado, porque debe de estar pendiente de sus animales siempre, pero sabe también que con este trabajo puede ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir criando a sus animales y seguir generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: The "1 de Mayo" (First of May) group is in its seventh loan cycle. All of the members work on their own. This is a very hardworking group from the city of Santaní, but members are from surrounding remote areas where there isn't access to these means. The majority of the members are rural women, and one of these is Sonia, who makes a living raising, selling or butchering farm animals, such as chickens, pigs, cows, goats and others. She says that it is demanding work because she has to be ever-mindful of her animals, but she also knows that this work can help her family. She is requesting the loan to purchase balanced feed for her animals, since in this way she can continuing raising her animals and generating income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land for planting coffee.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is happily married to Roberto. They are blessed with one child who is now in second year of college. Jenny manages a sari-sari store business and it has been a big help in their daily needs.  Aside from selling basic commodities, she also offers variety of food since her stall is located in front of a school. 

Jenny's dream is to gain more profits to sustain the educational needs of her child. To fulfill this dream, she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP that she will use to buy different commodities for her store and to buy raw ingredients needed in cooking a variety of foods to offer to her customers. She hopes that with her hard work, she can provide for the needs of her child.

loans.use: to buy different commodities for her store and raw materials for cooking foods

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Santa Libarada es un grupo muy trabajador de la ciudad de Encarnación, son mujeres que se unieron para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, y en el programa de comité de mujeres vieron una gran oportunidad. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para conocer los ingresos de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Victoria  es una de las miembros, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir que esta mejorando bastante, pero es consciente de que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo podrá ir mejorando. Ella cuenta que tiene un Kiosco  bien surtido, donde tiene de todo para ofrecer a sus clientes, y con los ingresos que tiene puede ayudar a su familia e invertir a su vez en el kiosco.
La Sra. Victoria Solicita de este crédito para la compra de golosinas, comestibles, jugos, y demás productos, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Santa Libarada is a hardworking group in the city of Encarnación. They are women united in order to improve their living conditions for themselves and their families, and they saw a great opportunity in the Women's Committee program. They are part of the poverty elimination survey, which assesses each individual's income.

One of the members, Victoria, was assessed at poverty level three during her last survey, which indicates that she has improved significantly, but through hard work and continued effort she could keep improving. She has a well-stocked kiosk where she offers many things to her customers, and with the income she is able to help her family and reinvest in her business. 

Victoria asks for this loan to buy snacks, food products, juices and other things that will help her to realize her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy snacks, food products, juices and other products.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La Sra. Guillermina es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo y sumada la ayuda de su marido, es que esta saliendo adelante, ella es una persona muy sacrificada y que se esfuerza por ir mejorando en lo que hace. Su crédito anterior de Kiva lo invirtió en la compra de productos para abastecer su despensa, lo que le ha sido de mucha ayuda.
Hoy nuevamente solicita de un crédito para poder seguir surtiendo su despensa con panificados, productos a granel, leche, verduras, frutas y demás, que le será de mucha ayuda. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Guillermina is a very hardworking person who is making headway thanks to her efforts and the help of her husband. She is a very devoted person who strives to keep improving in what she does. She invested her previous Kiva loan to purchase products to stock her store, which has been a big help. Today, she is once again requesting a loan so she can continue stocking her store with baked goods, bulk products, milk, vegetables, fruits and other items, which will help out a lot. She is grateful for this new opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase baked goods, bulk products, milk, vegetables, fruits and other items.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea is a 35-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has 4 children: the oldest is 17 and the youngest is 3. She runs a motorcycle transport service. Her husband is the one who operates the motorcycle, while she operates the motorcycle transport services. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy motorcycle parts and to pay for maintenance. In the future, Andrea would like to expand her motorcycle transport service so that it is successful and she would also like to improve their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts and to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 23 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea; it is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu: cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.

Rachel is single, and completed 12th grade. She describes herself as hardworking woman. For the past three years she been selling soft drinks in the local market in order to help herself. She started this business by selling for her mother, and she learned this business from her. She likes her business because of the ways people respond to it. Rachel is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. Her dream is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
This is Mai from Liberia. She resides in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for their beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.

Mai is 51 and married with three children. Her children are between the ages of 35 and 11. Only one is currently living at home and only two are in school. 

Mai has owned her own small local shop business selling fashion clothes for the past 20 years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more fashion clothes for her business.

On average, she works 10 hours at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with small money from her fiancée. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is controlling her own money. In the future, Mai would like to build a modern shop.
  
She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes for her business.

loans.name: Bandu

texts.en:
Bandu is 45 years old and lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu: cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. Along with her husband and four children between the ages of 24 and 17, only one is in school. Bandu completed 12th grade, and she has been selling pepper, oil, rice, salt etc., for the past 2 years in the local market, she is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, oil, rice, salt etc. for her business, She likes her business because it helps to support her home. She hopes to one day to own a house.
 
She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, rice, salt etc. for her business.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Rachael is a responsible married woman with three children living Masindi, Uganda. For ten years she has been running a salon business while also selling to boost her income. Being the good mother that she is, she has educated her children and supported her family, despite high competition. Rachael intends to use the loan to buy salon items like cosmetics and hair rollers to use.

loans.use: to buy salon items like vaccine treatment and rollers.

loans.name: Nason

texts.en: Nason is a 32-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail business for thirteen years, and has been farming as additional income. He started his business to become rich and to provide for his family. He hopes to expand business and educate his children to higher levels of education. However, lack of enough capital is his challenge in achieving these dreams. Nason is requesting a loan to buy soap, cooking oil and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, cooking oil and salt to sell.

loans.name: Doralice

texts.es:
Doralice es una joven muy soñadora, que se esta dedicando a sus estudios para poder crecer, cuenta que esta estudiando la carrera Ingeniería comercial, en una buena universidad. Cuenta también que ella es de una Familia numerosa y trabajadora, su primera meta es terminar su carrera universitaria y trabajar en la profesión, crecer como profesional, mejorar su situación económica, ayudar a sus padres y sacar adelante a la hija que tiene, darle una mejor vida.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de universidad, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Doralice is a young dreamer who has dedicated herself to her studies in order to grow. She says she is studying for a commercial engineering degree at a good university. She is from a large and hardworking family. Her primary goal is to graduate, work as a professor, grow as a professional, improve her financial situation, help her parents and make headway for her daughter to give her a better life. She is requesting the loan to pay her university dues, which will be a big help so she can continue her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay her university dues.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is 43 years old and is married with four children--two sons and two daughters. She and her husband have been running a business of raising and selling beansprouts for seven years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hue is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying tools and good quality beans to make better beansprouts to sell for her customers. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy tools and beans to raise and sell beansprouts.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 31-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. A mother of a 12-year-old son, she runs a bakery. She bakes bread. She has been making bread for almost two years now. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more ingredients, like flour, shortening, yeast and margarine, to continue to serve her customers and to add to the variety of her bread production.
