In the future, Vilma wound like expand her bakery to be able to pay her weekly contribution and also to be able to improve their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, shortening, yeast and margarine.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa works hard to support her family. Felisa is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Felisa requested a 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., to purchase materials and tools for the maintenance of her business.

Felisa has been in this business for nine years now.

Felisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials and tools for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Joaju Group

texts.es:
El comité  Kuña Guapa Joaju, se conformó con la iniciativa de una de las miembros.  Actualmente se encuentran  en el 1er ciclo, con catorce (14) integrantes, todas trabajaran y se ayudaran para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cuatro  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, pero están trabajando para poder seguir creciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Hayde, quien es una persona muy sacrificada que se dedica a lavar ropas de las personas de su barrio. Cuenta que su trabajo es muy duro, pero que está orgullosa de lo que hace ya que es un trabajo digno y decoroso, con el que ayuda a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de suavizantes para ropas, jabones y aromatizantes, para poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo. Agradecen por la ayuda que todas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa Joaju committee was formed by the initiative of one of its members. They are presently in their first loan cycle, with fourteen (14) members. They will all work and help each other to get ahead. They are involved in the poverty elimination survey and four of them are below the poverty line, but they are working to be able to continue improving.

One of the members is Señora Hayde. She is a very selfless person who works washing laundry for people in her neighbourhood. She reports that her work is very hard, but that she is proud of what she does because it is worthy and decent work which allows her to help her family. She is seeking this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of fabric softener, detergent and fabric freshener, in order to continue to work as she has been.

They are grateful for the help that they are all receiving.

loans.use: to buy fabric softener, detergent and fabric freshener.

loans.name: La Réponse Group

texts.fr: La cliente Brigitte est conseillère du collectif d’affaire « La réponse », jeune entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 30 ans et mère de 4 enfants, qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un commerçant de divers. La cliente est vendeuse de souliers au marché. Elle commença cette affaire avec son fond propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. il y a 9 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. L'insécurité constitue un obstacle pour son activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 6 ballons de souliers usés. Dans le futur, elle souhaite construire et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle bénit Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
This client, Brigitte, is advisor to the "La Réponse" business group. She is a young and dynamic entrepreneur, 30 years of age and mother of four children, all in school. Her husband is a trader of various merchandise.

The member sells shoes in the market. She began this business with funds received from her husband. Later, she was granted credit from the Hekima MFI, and has been performing this activity for the past nine years. Insecurity is an issue for her business activity.

This new loan will be used to buy six bales of worn shoes. In the future, she wants to build a home and further her children's education. So she blesses Hekima for supporting women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy 6 bales of worn shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 52-years-old, widowed, and blessed with two children. She owns and manages a retail store in their village for 25 years. She earns a daily net income of PHP 2,000. She wanted make her business more progressive and this is the reason why she would like to borrow PHP 15,000 to purchase biscuits, breads, canned goods, and beverages to sell. She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase biscuits, breads, canned goods, and beverages to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 66 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, milk, soap, spices, noodles, etc. Laura has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Laura aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, milk, soap, spices, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Binh would like to take a further loan to buy materials to make clothes. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and quality of materials to make clothes.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado VIRGEN DEL CARMEN está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer como cada una de ellas se encuentra en el ámbito general de sus vidas.
Una persona digna de destacar es la Sra. Luciana, quien es una persona muy trabajadora, es empleada domestica y también trabaja en la venta de comidas de variadas clases. Ella es muy luchadora y cuenta que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por su familia, para poder darles todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carnes, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los comestibles que vende, y seguir procurando por un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Virgen del Carmen' is in their second cycle of the women's committee program and they are participating in the poverty elimination survey which aims to find out how each one of them is doing in their daily lives.

One noteworthy member is Luciana, a hardworking lady who is a housekeeper and also has a business selling foods of various kinds. She is a fighter and puts in all her effort for her family to give them everything they need and ensure they do not have to go through the difficulties that she had to endure.

Luciana has applied for this loan to purchase meat, vegetables, condiments and other supplies in order to continue selling groceries, and so that she can continue to strive for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, condiments and other supplies

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gema is 44 years old and has one child who is in school.

Gema has a general store business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Gema has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make soap

loans.name: Lida

texts.en: Lida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy stocks of items such as shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, sugar, cream, etc. to sell in her general store business. Lida has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening. Lida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of items such as shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, sugar, cream, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mougnou Ani Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Mougnou Ani Sabali est constitué de quatre  femmes dont 2 mariées et 2 célibataires résidant dans les grandes familles traditionnelles élargies à Banconi-Farada, un des quartiers périphérique de la Commune I du district de Bamako. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 4 enfants. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Banconi-Farada. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de Charbon de bois, des Habits, des poissons fumés en provenance de Mopti, des fruits et légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ier  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Massan (femme assise à l’extrême droite) est une grande vendeuse de fruits et légumes de toutes sortes dans le marché de Banconi Farada. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un chargement de charrette de mangues et des ananas. Elle s’approvisionne en fruits aux marchés de Bamako. La revente se fait  au comptant au marché à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Massan espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Mougnou Ani Sabali group consists of four women of whom two are married and two are single, all living in large traditional extended families in Banconi-Farada, a peripheral neighborhood in Commune I of the Bamako district. They average 31 years of age with four children.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Banconi-Farada market. Group members are small retail merchants of charcoal, clothing, smoked fish from Mopti, fruit and vegetables.

To increase their working capital, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle. 

Mrs. Massan (the woman sitting on the far right) is a big seller of fruit and vegetables of all kinds at the Banconi-Farada market . She plans to use the loan to buy a cartload of mangoes and pineapples.

She gets her fruit supplies from the markets in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted at the market, for cash, to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Mrs. Massan hope to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in the business and to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: buy fruit

loans.name: Hay

texts.en: Hay, a 49-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has one daughter. She supports her family by running a business of fabricating screws and metal parts, and she also makes clothing. Hay requests a loan to pay for a metal processing machine to increase her production of screws and metal parts. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for a metal processing machine.

loans.name: Vi

texts.en:
Vi is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales. She also hopes that it will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en: Claudia is a farmer from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of four grown-up children. She has been in the farming business for more than five years now together with her husband. This is the source of their income. Claudia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for their farm. Through this, she will be able to improve the farm as well as their harvest. In the future, Claudia hopes of making her business a success and a stable source of their income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is a 54-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 2 sons and 2 daughters. She and her husband earn a living running a motorcycle repair shop, which they have done for 38 years. Huong would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of spare parts to stock. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and increase the turnover of her business. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of spare parts for her motorcycle repair business.

loans.name: Hinh

texts.en:
Hinh, 46, is single and has been supporting her family by operating a printing shop. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hinh has been in business for ten years. She plans to use this loan to buy printing materials and tools. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy printing materials and tools.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong, a 46-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has three children. She supports her family by running a clothing business. Hong requests a loan to purchase more products such as cloth, needles, and thread to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as cloth, needles, and thread for her clothing business.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Ha is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety of food such as sugars, milk and soft drinks to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of food such as sugars, milk and soft drinks, to sell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy runs a sari-sari store business in her village. She wishes to have good health and manage her business well. Joy is married and blessed with two children. Her husband works in a rice mill. Through their combined profits, they have been able to send their children to school. Joy always tries to think of strategies to expand her business. She is willing to improve her skills in running her business to make it flourish. In this regard, Joy is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy beverages, breads and spices. She is hoping that her business will become more stable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy beverages, bread and spices.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en: Tien is requesting a new loan to buy many kinds of goods including sugar and beverages to stock her general store. Tien's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of goods including sugar and beverages for her general store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of two grown up children. Delia has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her family's income. Delia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm. Through this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. In the future, Delia hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Mab's Group

texts.en: Residing in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Mab is aged 33 years old and is married. She has one daughter. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming cassava on three hectares of farmland. From this business her family earns about 33,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. Mab is with VisionFund this cycle. She now leads her group in asking for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Mab is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is a 39-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has one daughter. She earns a living running a general store, which she has done for the past 10 years. Thuy would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is a 33-year-old married man with one son. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. Phuong earns money with the business of repairing motorcycles and selling parts. He has been involved in this business for ten years. Now, Phuong would like to take a loan to invest in his business. He plans to use this loan to buy motorcycle parts to stock his store and to serve more customers. He hopes that through this loan, he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. This will enable him to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts to stock his store and to serve more customers.

loans.name: Loc

texts.en:
Loc is 60 years old and married with two sons and one daughter. She and her husband support their family by selling noodles in the local community. She would like a loan to increase the working capital for her business, which will enable her to buy better food such as meat, noodles and beverages to sell at higher margins. 

She hopes that through the loan she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better food such as meat, noodles and beverages to sell at higher margins.

loans.name: Quy

texts.en:
Quy is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as rices and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as rices and beverages, to sell

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Sorn is a 34-year-old married mother of three children. Rice farming and cassava planting have been the main sources of her family’s income for 14 years. She can earn about 30,000KHR per day to meet her family’s needs and manages to save about 17,000KHR each day for their future needs.

Sorn has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely repaid the loans. The past loans have helped Sorn better support her family. Now she is applying for another loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice and cassava fruitfully and healthily, and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Yuang

texts.en:
Yuang is 41 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has four children to take care of. 

Rice farming and cassava growing are the primary sources of her family’s income, and she has been in this business for five years. With her current business, she can earn approximately 38,000KHR per day and save about 10,000KHR each day for their future needs.

This is the second micro loan for Yuang with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loan helped her better support her family with enough food. Now she is applying for another loan of 2,000,000KHR to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 26 years old and married with three children.

Maricel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like laundry soap, sugar, bath soap, coffee, biscuits and other groceries in her general store.

Maricel has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income from frozen foods vending.

Maricel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like laundry soap, sugar, bath soap, coffee, biscuits and other groceries.

loans.name: Yervand

texts.en:
For several years farming and agriculture have been the only source of income for Yervand’s family. In the Zovaber village in Gegharkunik area they have a plot of land and a not big farm which includes three cows, two heifers, four sheep, three lambs, one goat and fifteen chickens. In agriculture, the only occupation they have is potato cultivation. All work around the farm Yervand does with the help and advice of his parents. 

Yervand is married and he has a year old son. His wife is musician. She used to work as a piano teacher, but now she doesn't work and takes care of their son.

Yervand and his father have decided to enlarge their potato cultivating activities and they are asking for a loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of potato seedlings, organize cultivation works and to buy fodder for his animals.

loans.use: to buy a lot of potato seedlings, organize cultivation works and to buy fodder for his animals.

loans.name: Thiet

texts.en:
Thiet is requesting a new loan to buy a sewing machine. Thiet's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Feruza

texts.ru:
Фируза молодая женщина 24 лет. Родилась и выросла в Канибадаме. Рано вышла замуж,имеет двоих детей но после рождения второго ребенка , муж оставил их одних и ушел к другой.  Ей было очень одиноко и она решила пойти в родительский дом. Но там ей тоже были не рады,потому что ее мама  давно умерла а отец совсем старый и жить им самим было тяжело.  Брат Фирузы живет со своей семьей,они тоже еле проживают и он не может помочь своей сестре.  
Фируза сама решила зарабатывать на жизнь и на последние деньги,что у нее были купила себе бычка. Она начала ухаживать за ним и когда он немного подрос она продала за выгодную цену и купила двух маленьких телят. Так она стала расширять свой бизнес. Вот уже более двух лет Фируза занимается выращиванием скота. У нее уже на счету более пяти голов. Фируза очень довольна своим делом так как этот бизнес дает ей не плохой доход. Она планирует в будущем накопив денег купить собственный дом и жить с детьми  не зависимо не от кого.  
На данный момент Фируза хочет еще купить скот но она нуждается в денежных средствах, по совету знакомых она решила подать заявку на кредит и обратилась в организацию Арванд. Очень надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Firuza is a young woman of 24 years. She was born and grew up in Kanibadam. She got married early, and she has two children, but after giving birth to the second one her husband left them for another woman. Firuza was very lonely and she decided to go to her parent's house. But she was not happy there either, as her mother died long time ago and her father is very old, and living together with him was hard. Firuza's brother lives with his own family, and they also barely survive and he is not able to help his sister. 

Firuza decided to earn money for living herself and with the last money she had she bought a goby, She started to take care of it and when he grew some, she sold him at a good price and bought two small calves. This way she started growing her business. Now she has been breeding cattle for more than two years. She already has more than five heads of cattle due to this. 

Firuza is very happy with her business as it gives her a good income. After having saved money, she plans to purchase her own house in the future, and live with her children, not dependent on anyone. Currently Firuza would like to purchase more cattle, but she needs financial means. At the advice of an acquaintance, she decided to submit an application for a loan and turned to the organization "Arvand". She hopes very much for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Alirio Enrique

texts.es:
Alirio tiene 38 años de edad, y se visiona como un gran empresario. Tener su propio negocio se ha convertido en su mayor reto, por el cual se encuentra luchando a fin de transformarlo en su realidad. En la actualidad carece de recursos económicos, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de ropa y calzado, artículos que comercializará en los municipios cercanos.
Sueña en un futuro cercano tener varias tiendas de ropa y garantizarle a su familia una calidad de vida digna.
texts.en:
Alirio, 38, sees himself as a great entrepreneur.  He has his own business which has become his greatest challenge; and he struggles to turn it into a reality.  At present he does not have the economic resources he needs and therefore is requesting a loan to buy clothing and shoes which he will sell in nearby towns.

His dream for the near future is to have several clothing stores so he can guarantee a decent lifestyle for his family.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ángela desea dedicarse a la venta de comidas rápidas, actividad que aprendió desde hace tres años, en un restaurante donde laboró por más de seis meses. Posteriormente consiguió trabajo como empleada doméstica realizando oficios varios, con el fin de garantizarle a sus dos hijas menores de edad una mejor calidad de vida.
En la actualidad Ángela desea alternar el oficio de empleada doméstica con la venta de comidas rápidas ya que desea brindarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad. Razón que la ha motivado a solicitar un crédito que invertirá en la compra de un carro de comidas rápidas y surtido. 
Sueña con mejorar su condición económica y sacar su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Ángela wants to sell fast food which is a business she learned about three years ago at a restaurant where she worked six months.  After that job she started working in the domestic employee sector in order to give her two small daughters a better quality of life.

Now, Ángela wants to alternate her work activity with the sale of fast food in order to give her children a quality education.  This is why she is requesting a loan to buy a fast food cart and supplies.  Her goal is to improve her economic situation so her family can prosper.

loans.use: To buy a fast food cart and supplies.

loans.name: Thary

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Thary is aged 27 years and married with two children. To make a living and support the family, Thary and her husband have been farming rice and cassava as their primary business for nine years. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Thary has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle. She completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan. Thary is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
This is Mario. He previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase beauty and hair products for his salon. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household, and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy more beauty and hair products for his salon. His profits from the business will definitely help sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Mario dreams to expand his business and to have more customers. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty and hair products for his salon

loans.name: Camilo Andrés

texts.es:
Camilo Andrés es un joven de 25 años de edad, el cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para iniciar su negocio; consistente en la compra de ganado de levante, el cual tendrá en la finca de su padre en la vereda la Aurora. Asegura que conoce de la actividad por tradición familiar.
Hoy desea convertirse en un  gran microempresario y mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y su hijo de cuatro años,
Su mayor sueño es mejorar su condición económica y poder acceder a una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Camilo Andrés, 25, is a young man who is requesting a loan to start his own business.  He wants to buy cattle to raise on his father's farm along the Aurora path.  He claims to know the business through family tradition.

He wants to become an important small business owner and improve the quality of life for his wife and four-year-old son.  His goal is to improve his economic situation so he can buy his own home.

loans.use: To buy cattle to raise.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
Phat is aged 53 years and widowed with seven children living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice, which they have been doing for 32 years. The current business earns them about 20,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Phat's group consists of two members who live in the same village. The group is now applying for another loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Phat is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 29-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business of selling welding material eight years ago. Abida is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. 

He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of welding products including iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods, and welding rods so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Abida hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. 

She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase iron rods, iron sheets, soldering rods and welding rods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a professional camera.

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
Mario, se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre trabajador y con muy buenas proyecciones. Su habilidad para relacionarse con la gente le ha permitido convertirse en un gran líder. Trabajó por varios años en el campo por lo cual desea invertir en la compra de ganado, que tendrá en compañía con un hermano, mientras el se dedicará a la administración de un estadero que arrendará en el sector donde reside.
Para el desarrollo de estas dos actividades, Mario se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido (mecatos), silletería, mesas y vacas lecheras. 
Sueña con brindarle a sus gemelas de tan sólo tres meses de nacidas una calidad de vida digna.
texts.en:
Mario is known as a hard-working man with very good projects.  His ability to relate to people has allowed him to become a great leader.  He has worked for several years in agriculture and wants to buy cattle together with his brother.  Meanwhile, he will manage the guest house and tavern that he will rent out in the area where he lives.

In order to carry out both businesses, Mario is requesting a loan to buy pastries, tables and chairs, and dairy cows.

His goal is to give his three-month-old twin girls a decent quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a variety of pastries, tables and chairs, and dairy cows.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 60 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like sugar, coffee, snack foods, laundry soap, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.

Norma has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, coffee, snack foods, laundry soap, noodles, etc. 

Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, coffee, snack foods, laundry soap, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Yuri Andrea

texts.es:
Yuri de 25 años de edad, tomó la decisión de iniciar con su proyecto de negocio.
Desde hace 20 días abrió al público una tienda, dedicada a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar. Con el fin de realizar las adecuaciones locativas y comprar algunos productos que le han solicitado con frecuencia, se encuentra solicitando un crédito, ya que no posee los recursos para dicha inversión.
Asegura que el haber trabajado por varios años en un mini-mercado, le permitió adquirir la experiencia y el conocimiento para administrar su propia negocio.
Hoy siente que muchos de sus sueños se cumplen y agradece a Dios la oportunidad de convertirse en microempresaria.
texts.en:
Yuri, 25, made the decision to begin the project of opening a business. Twenty days ago she opened to the public her store that sells household staples. She is requesting a loan in order to make improvements to her location and to purchase some products that have been frequently requested. She would like a loan because she does not have the recourses herself for the investment. 

She says she has worked for several years in a mini-mart, which gave her the experience and knowledge she needs to manage her own business. Today she feels that she is accomplishing her dreams and is thankful to God for the opportunity to become a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: Make alterations to the store and purchase basic household staples

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: Georgette est une femme de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants. elle possède une mini restaurant dans un quartier de la ville depuis 20 ans. elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières à savoir poissons, macabo, vivre frais, riz, plantains etc afin d'augmenter ses ventes et son profit. Les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'agrandir son activité d'une part et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part.
texts.en:
Georgette is a 50-year-old woman, married and mother of three children. She has been running a mini-restaurant in one of the city's neighborhoods for the past 20 years.

She is requesting a loan to strengthen her stock of raw ingredients namely fish, cocoyam tubers, fresh produce, rice, plantain bananas, etc., to increase sales and profit.

The profits generated will help her expand her business and also meet her family's needs.

loans.use: buy food ingredients

loans.name: Esnilda Cristina

texts.es:
Esnilda es una mujer de 44 años, esforzada madre soltera que asumió la responsabilidad de educar y sacar adelante a sus hijos que ahora están terminando la escuela y se preparan para ir al colegio, a pesar de que Esnilda solo cursó los estudios primarios, ella ha podido siempre la disposición para trabajar y siempre llevar el sustento a su hogar. Actualmente vive con sus 2 hijos en la Parroquia de Río Verde de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Gracias al consejo de una amiga, Esnilda emprendió con la compra – venta de libros nuevos y usados que los distribuye en las zonas rurales donde hay escasez de librerías que fomenten la cultura y educación de los niños y jóvenes. Esnilda trabaja todos los días en un horario de 8 horas y lo hace recorriendo las calles de su ciudad comprando los libros que las personas de la ciudad ya no usan pero que podrían utilizarlos en otros lugares, también va a los almacenes que le proveen de libros nuevos que le piden sus clientes de las zonas que visita. Es un trabajo que le gusta mucho realizar pues ella también hace uso de los libros para aprender cosas nuevas. En la actualidad y por el mejoramiento de la educación que se está dando en todas las zonas, hay una demanda considerable de libros de motivación y liderazgo por lo que Esnilda requiere un préstamo que lo utilizará en la compra de estos libros para llevar a sus clientes que los solicitan y también motivar a todos sus clientes a leer este tipo de libros que pueden ser de mucha ayuda. Con este incremento en la variedad de sus productos, Esnilda está segura que obtendrá utilidades adicionales además de la satisfacción de poder ayudar a las personas a tener un crecimiento personal asegurado. 
Esnilda sueña con poder proveer a sus hijos siempre una educación de calidad hasta verlos convertidos en profesionales de excelencia y que sean un aporte positivo para el país. Ha realizado un par de créditos anteriormente y sus cuotas siempre han sido puntuales además que ha asistido a una de las capacitaciones que Fundación Alternativa ha prestado a sus clientes y le pareció muy valioso para ponerlo en práctica. Gracias a esta Fundación, Esnilda ha podido capitalizar su negocio y ha recibido de ellos un trato agradable que no  encontró en otras instituciones financieras.
texts.en:
Esnilda, a woman of 44 years, is a courageous single mother who assumed the responsibility of educating her children and getting them ahead in life. They are now finishing with primary school and preparing for secondary school, in spite of the fact that Esnilda only received a primary education. She has always been willing to work and provide for her family.

She currently lives with her two children in the Río Verde Parrish of Santo Domingo. Santo Domingo is the capital of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, a province of Ecuador which has sustained high growth over the past number of years. The most attractive and interesting feature of Santo Domingo city is its delicious fruit and the local gastronomy. The level of business carried out here is also considerable as it has become an inland hub for commercial activity between the country’s mountain and coastal regions. Furthermore, its many tourist attractions and warm climate make it a popular destination for domestic and foreign tourists. For this reason, most of the city’s inhabitants are involved in some form of commercial activity or service for local residents and tourists.

Thanks to the advice of a friend, Esnilda began buying and selling new and used books that she distributes in rural areas where there is a scarcity of book stores that might encourage culture and the education of children and young people. Esnilda works 8 hours every day, going through the streets of her city buying books that the people of the city don’t want anymore, but that could be used in other places. She also visits warehouses to get books that her customers have requested. She enjoys the work a lot and also uses the books to learn new things. 

Currently there is considerable demand for motivational and leadership books to improve the education that is being given in all the areas. Esnilda needs a loan to purchase these books to bring out to the customers that have requested them, and also to motivate all her customers to read this genre of books that can be very helpful. With the increase in variety of books, Esnilda is certain that she will enjoy additional profits as well as the satisfaction of helping her customers grow personally. 

Esnilda’s dream is to provide her children with a good education until she can see them become excellent professionals and positive members of the country. 

She has taken out a couple of loans before and her payments have always been on time. She has also attended one of the trainings that the Fundación Alternativa puts on for its customers. She has been very brave in putting the training into practice. Thanks to the foundation, Esnilda has not only been able to capitalize her business, but has also enjoyed good treatment by the foundation, something she has not encountered in other financial institutions.

loans.use: purchase wholesale books on motivation

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso es un campesino de 53 años de edad, dedicado a las labores agrícolas desde su juventud. Ama el campo y asegura que este le ha permitido alcanzar muchas de sus metas y crear su propio negocio. Desde hace algunos años viene trabajando con huevos de codorniz desde su vereda. En la actualidad desea expandir su negocio debido a la demanda de su producto, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de codornices.
Uno de sus mayores deseos es poder tecnificar los procesos de producción con el fin de reducir costos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Alfonso is a 53-year-old farmer who has worked in agriculture since his childhood. He loves the fields and he is confident that this has allowed him to achieve many of his goals and to create his own business. He has worked with quail eggs from his area for several years. 

He would currently like to expand his business due to the demand for his product, so he has applied for a loan which he will invest in the purchase of quails. One of his greatest wishes is to be able to make his production processes more technical in order to reduce costs and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy quails.

loans.name: Aurora Esther

texts.es:
Aurora a sus 33 años de edad se dedica al engorde y venta de pollos en un pequeño galpón adecuado en el solar de su casa. Esta actividad la aprendió de manera empírica debido a  la necesidad e generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida.  En la actualidad, la señora Aurora necesita de la compra de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para realizar dicha inversión. 
Su mayor sueño es tener una finca para expandir su negocio y mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en: Aurora, 33, makes a living fattening and selling chickens in a small shed on a plot of land near her house. She learned about this business empirically due to her need to earn an income to sustain her household and improve her quality of life. She currently needs to buy chickens to fatten and egg-laying hens, so she has applied for a loan to make this investment. Her greatest dream is to have a ranch to expand her business and improve her economic status.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten and egg-laying hens.

loans.name: Chayleng's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Chayleng is a 30-year-old married mother of two children. She and her husband have earned a living through farming rice and growing cassava for 11 years. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

Chayleng has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She has completely paid back the previous loan, which helped her alleviate her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion to spend on labor fees. With this loan, she hopes to increase her current business income to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 30-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, making it difficult for him to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Abida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to pay to repair the rickshaw. This will help him continue his business. Abida is very grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Tbaung Khmum district of the Kampong Cham province, Sophea is 26 years old and married. She has two children. To earn a living, Sophea and her husband have been farming rice for eight years. They supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee. Their current business earns them about 30,000 KHR per day and they manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 

Sophea is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: El Sr. Eusebio tiene 30 años y tiene  3 hijos que son de las edades de  6, 8 y 2  años, el es agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de sandia y frutales en su parcela que se encuentran en la localidad de Pampa el Coscal,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Eusebio va a usar este préstamo para la siembra de sandia y el mantenimiento de sus cítricos para la posterior cosecha, El Sr. Eusebio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios para aumentar su producción,  El Sr. Eusebio vende sus productos en el mercado de la localidad directamente del productor al consumidor, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que esta es su única actividad desde hace varios años que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 30 and has three children, ages 2, 6, and 8. He is a farmer, planting watermelon and fruit trees on his plot of land located in the Papa el Coscal locality. 

This is his first loan sequence within the intuition. Eusebio will use the loan to plant watermelon and maintain his citrus trees for the following harvest. One challenge Eusebio faces in his work is to improve his quality of life. He will use the earnings to increase his production. Eusebio sells his goods in the market in his locality, directly from the producer to the consumer. 

He is happy and grateful for the opportunity that the loan provides him since this has been his only work for many years, and it allows him to support himself and his family.

loans.use: plant watermelon

loans.name: Blanca Libia

texts.es:
A sus 50 años, la señora Blanca es madre de cinco hijos, uno de ellos menor de edad, por el cual vela a fin de brindarle alimentación, vivienda y una buena educación. 
Blanca ha vivido toda su vida en el campo y actualmente se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollos de engorde y concentrado con el ánimo continuar con su actividad económica y cumplir con las obligaciones de su hogar y el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca, 50, is the mother of five children. One of them is underage, so she works hard in order to provide her/him [the gender is not specified] with food, a roof and good education.

Blanca has lived all her life in the countryside and is now requesting a loan to buy chickens to fatten and concentrate feed, with the intention to continue working and be able to fulfill all her responsibilities and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten and concentrate feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is 39 years old and married with two children.  She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City.  Her husband earns income by working as an electrician.  Loan has been working on planting and selling spinach for 2 years.

She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying fertilizrer, tools and other materials for her planting to meet her current customer's needs and to attract more new customers.  She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizrer, tools and other materials for her planting

loans.name: Noel De Jesús

texts.es:
Noel trabaja como agricultor desde hace 10 años y es esta actividad la que le permite generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
Aprendió el oficio, gracias a  su padre quien se dedicó a la misma actividad. Actualmente, tiene un cultivo de café, el cual se ha convertido en su principal fuente económica. Con la necesidad de mejorar su cultivo y poder superar las dificultades que se han presentado por la temporada invernal, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos y riegos.  Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Noel has been working in farming for 10 years, which has enabled him to support his family.  He learned his trade from his father who worked in the same trade.  He currently grows coffee, which has become his main source of income.  As he needs to improve his yield and overcome the difficulties posed by the winter season, he is applying for a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure and sprinklers.  He dreams of improving his income and, with it, his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as manure and sprinklers

loans.name: Sreykol

texts.en:
Sreykol is 35 years old and a villager from Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province.  She is married and has five dependent children to cater for as they are still in school.  For her kids’ sake, she does rice cropping on two hectares as the main source of income.  She has been involved in the current business for ages and is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day.  

This is the second microloan for Sreykol with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has fully repaid back her past loan with success and it has enabled her to provide daily decent food for her kids.  Now, her son wants to learn the Korean Language for a career opportunity.  Therefore, she is applying for an education loan to pay for her son’s tuition fee.  She hopes that her son will complete this short training course with a positive outcome and get a good job to earn more income to help the family.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s tuition fee

loans.name: Sengkun

texts.en:
Residing in Bakan district of Pursat Province, Sengkun is a 46-year-old mother of four kids who are students in the local state school.  To provide the daily decent food for her kids, she sells grocery items and raises pigs.  The current business has returned her about 38,000 KHR per day in income.  

This is not the first loan for Senghun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She can support her pig raising business on time from the past loan that she has completely repaid back. Now, she is seeking for a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy pig feed and vaccinations for her pigs.  She hopes that she can raise healthy pigs and sell it at a high price so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and vaccinations for her pigs

loans.name: Chanroeun

texts.en:
A mother of four kids who are in school and living in Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, Chanroeun is 33 years old and one of many villagers in the local area who raises ducks and grows rice as the main source of income.  She has involved in this business for ages. Including this loan.  

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past three loan cycles.  These loan have sustained her business and returned her a decent income, up to 40,400 KHR per day.  Now, she is seeking for a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR.  She will spend her loan portion to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer and to pay for transplanting fees for her cash crop.  She has high hopes that she will increase her income from her business and expand greatly expand it.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of fertilizer and to pay for transplanting fees

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio a sus 21 años de edad se dedica a trabajar la agricultura, como actividad económica. Actualmente, tiene cultivos de maíz en un terreno alquilado en una  finca familiar. Debido al invierno los cultivos han venido presentando inconvenientes, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de semillas, abonos y riegos agrícolas que le permitan mejorar sus cultivos y obtener una producir de mayor calidad, Lo que le permitirá vendarlas a un mejor precio y generar mejores ingresos para su núcleo familiar.
texts.en: Sergio, who is 21, earns his living working in agriculture.  He currently grows corn on a rented plot of land at a local farm.   As the winter has badly affected his crops, he is seeking a loan to buy seeds, manure and agricultural sprinklers, which should enable him to improve his yield and obtain a higher quality product.  This will mean that he can sell his crops at a better price and generate a higher income for his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and agricultural sprinklers

loans.name: Don's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Don is 58 years old and married.  She has seven children.  To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava for 39 years.  They supplement the income by working for others for a fee. 

The current business earns her family about 18,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.  Don’s group consists of two members who are just with VisionFund this cycle.  Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to use a portion of it to spend on labor fees.  She hopes to increase her income from the current business so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is 52 years old woman.  She lives in Lahore, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother of 6 children.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income.  He wants to repair it as soon as possible.  However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw.  Therefore Irshad has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw.  This will help him to continue his business.  Irshad is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairing rickshaw

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Leap is a 32-year-old married mother of two children who are dependents, one of whom is in school.  Rice farming and cassava growing have been the main sources of her family’s income for 14 years.  To better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband works as a paid worker.  Together, they can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and manage to save about 8,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Leap’s group consists of three members who are just with VisionFund for this cycle.  Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan.  Leap, who is the leader, wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her rice and cassava.  With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice and cassava fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her rice and cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sergio Alberto

texts.es:
Sergio, se dedica a la jardinería, actividad que aprendió desde hace más de 14 años. Trabajó toda su vida como empleado en diferentes fincas de su localidad.
Desde hace un año tomó la determinación de independizarse y dedicarse  a prestar el servicio de mantenimiento de jardines. Asegura que hasta la fecha a tenidos buenos resultados, por lo cual desea continuar con el desarrollo de la actividad y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una guadaña con el fin  de mejorar la calidad en el servicio y aumentar sus ingresos.
Su mayor anhelo es  compartir grandes momentos con sus tres hijos y garantizarles una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Sergio makes a living as a gardener, having learned his trade over 14 years ago.  Sergio had worked all his life as an employer in various local farms.

However, a year ago, Sergio was determined to become independent and offer gardening services on his own.  He tells us that, for now, he has had only good results and so Sergio wants to continue with this work.  To do this, he is applying for a loan in order to buy a scythe.  This will allow him to improve the quality of service he offers and to increase his income.

Sergio's biggest desire is to spend good times with his three children and to guarantee them a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a scythe.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea is 29 years old and married.  She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province.  She has two dependent children to take care of and one of them is in school.  Rice farming and cassava planting is the primary source of her family’s income and she has been in this business for 11 years. 

They supplement the income by working for others for a fee.  With the current business, she can earn approximately 20,000 KHR per day and save about 9,000KHR each day for the future needs.  Kunthea is just with VisionFund this loan cycle.  Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland.  She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is 41 years old woman.  She lives in Lahore, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother of five children.  Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.  For the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income.  He wants to repair it as soon as possible.  However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.  Therefore Zahida has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw.  This will help him to continue his business.  Zahida is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw

loans.name: Edwin Andrés

texts.es:
Edwin a sus 21 años de edad, conserva la actividad que heredó de su padre. Se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando tomate de árbol y papa criolla en una vereda del municipio de Sonsón, al oriente de Antioquia. Su cosecha es comercializada en la plaza de mercado del municipio. Sueña ampliar su capacidad de producción, y mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono y riegos para su cultivo, así generará una mejor producción e incrementará las ventas.
Sueña con ingresar a al universidad y convertirse en un gran empresario.
texts.en: Edwin, who is 21, continues the business which he inherited from his father.  He works in agriculture, growing tree tomatoes and papas criollas (yellow potatoes) in a district of the municipality of Sonsón, in the west of Antioquia department.  He sells his produce in the municipality's marketplace.  He dreams of expanding his production capacity and improving his quality of life and so he is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure and sprinklers for his crop.  This will enable him to boost his yield and improve his sales.  He dreams of going to university and becoming a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (manure and sprinklers)

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz, de 57 años de dad, es una mujer viuda a la que le tocó educar y sacar adelante con esfuerzo y mucho sacrificio a sus cuatro hijos. Ha laborado en oficios varios por más de 20 años, pero en la actualidad desea trabajar como independiente  dedicada a la venta de toda clase de fritos en  su sector de residencia. 
Con el propósito de gozar de una vejez tranquila. Luz se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en  la compra de una estufa, vitrina y materia prima, lo que le permitirá iniciar su con su proyecto de negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is 57 years old and a widow.  With a lot of effort and sacrifice, Luz now has to bring up her four children and help them get ahead in life.  She has worked in various position over the last twenty years but she now wants to work independently selling fried foods in her local town.

In order to enjoy her old age peacefully, Luz is applying for a loan to invest in buying a heater, display and case and basic materials.  This will allow her to start up her business and improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a heater, display case and basic materials.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Edgar es un hombre soñador y trabajador, cuenta que desde los ocho años de edad inició vendiendo periódicos locales, con el fin de colaborar con los gastos del hogar, debido a que por condiciones adversas se convirtió en madre soltera. 
Desde hace más de 10 años viene trabajando en oficios varios, pero hoy desea comenzar con su proyecto de negocio y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido como acolchados, cobijas, manteles entre otros, los cuales comercializará en su localidad y en los municipios cercanos.
Sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida y garantizarles a sus cuatro hijos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Edgar is hard-working and dreams big.  He tells us that at the age of eight years old he began selling local newspapers in order to help with household bills.  Due to adverse conditions, Edgar was brought up by only his mother, who was single.

Edgar has been working in various positions over the last ten years but now he would like to start his own business.  To do this, Edgar is applying for a loan in order to buy stock (quilting, blankets, tablecloths and more).  He will sell this items in his local area and in nearby towns.

Edgar dreams of improving his quality of living and of guaranteeing his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy stock (quilting, blankets and tablecloths).

loans.name: Yrene

texts.es:
Yrene, de 33 años de edad, está casada con Félix y vive en compañía de sus 02 hijos de 16 y 04 años de edad respectivamente en su casa propia. Yrene se dedica a la agricultura, por está razón siembra cacao, plátano y otros productos regionales pues lo ha visto como un negocio sumamente rentable, para realizar está actividad cuenta con un terreno de 15 hectáreas, de las cuales 03 estan en producción, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 06 años gracias al incentivo del gobierno regional quien les proporcionó las semillas, además del apoyo de su esposo y su hijo en las labores de mantenimiento. Le gusta esta actividad por ha visto que le da muy buenas ganancias, pues sus productos tienen un buen precio en le mercado actual. Este será su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles comprará abono orgánico para la cosecha de cacao, plátano y otros productos.
texts.en: 33-year-old Yrene is married to Félix and lives in her own home with her two children of 16and 4 years of age.  Yrene works in agriculture, growing cocoa, bananas and other local products, as she recognised this as a highly profitable business.  She has a 15-hectare plot, 3 hectares of which are in production, and has been farming it for 6 years, helped by a regional government incentive which enabled her to obtain seeds and the support of her husband and son who do the maintenance work.  She likes her work; it generates a very good income, as her produce currently has a good market price.  This will be her first Kiva loan and she is very grateful for the financial help which will enable her to make progress.  She is committed, therefore, to make her repayments punctually.  She will use the 2500 nuevos soles requested to buy organic compost for her cocoa, bananas and other produce.

loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La Sra. Verónica tiene 29 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 2 años, ella se dedica al servicio de todo tipo de impresiones y diseño grafico, en su imprenta que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Toledo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Verónica va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de vitrinas para muestra de sus productos terminados  para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo,  La Sra. Verónica enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen muchas imprentas por la zona y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando equipos y materiales que necesita y su deseo es tener  equipos modernos para brindar a su clientela un servicio de calidad.
texts.en: Verónica is 29 years old and has a 2 year old child. She works providing a all kinds of printing and graphic design services. Her printing press is located in the Toledo area. This loan is her first cycle in the institution. Verónica is going to use this loan to buy display cases to show her finished work for her business. Her reason for asking for this loan is a lack of cash. Verónica faces challenges in her business such as the competition, since there are a lot of printing presses in the area. She is going to use the profits to keep buying equipment and materials that she needs and her wish is to have modern equipment to offer her customers a quality service.

loans.use: to buy display cases.

loans.name: Azamat

texts.ru: Азамат житель района Кубадиён. Ему 33 года. У него есть жена, двое сыновей и двое дочерей. Азамат имеет высшее образование. Он работает инженером на телефонной станции. Азамат одновременно хочет заняться животноводческим бизнесом. Его интересует купля и продажа крупного рогатого скота. У него при дворе дома имеется коровник. Азамат планирует закупать по 5 голов бычков, откармливать их в течение одного месяца и затем продавать их на местном рынке с наценкой. Это довольно прибыльное дело и Азамат таким образом хочет улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Азамат просит кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота и его корма.
texts.en: Azamat lives in Kubadiyon. He is 33, married, and has two sons and two daughters. He has a college degree, and works as an engineer at the telephone office. He would like to launch a livestock business on the side, buying and selling cattle. He has a cattle shed in his yard. He plans to buy five bulls, fatten them for a month, and then sell them on the local market for a profit. This is a rather profitable business, and Azamat wants to use it to improve his family's finances. He is requesting a loan to buy cattle and feed.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: La Sra. Gabriela sigue con la misma actividad del tejido de mantas y  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de lana por mayor,   en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de lana también, ya que esta época de invierno tiene mucha demanda y ya tiene pedidos que entregar, la Sra. Gabriela se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Gabriela stills works weaving blankets.  She says that her previous loan was a success as she used it to buy wool in bulk.  She is now applying for a loan to buy more wool as it is winter; demand is high and she has orders to fulfil.  Gabriela is happy and grateful for this opportunity to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero. Es una persona que tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura. Oficio que aprendió de su madre ya que se crío sin padre. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. Junto a su madre para prepararse para irse a la parcela que alquila; pasa todo el día trabajando en la noche cuida una finca. Él compra el abono, la semilla, el veneno, etc en la ciudad, camina 2 kilómetros para llegar a la carretera principal para luego subir al bus que lo lleva a la ciudad en donde compra mas barato los insumos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, semilla, pesticidas y herbicidas, para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y para pagar el alquiler de la tierra. Con la cosecha, poseerá un buen ingreso para el sustento de su madre y de él. Planea comprar un terreno para hacer su casa y poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre
texts.en:
Eduardo is 26 years old and single. He has been working in agriculture for several years. He learned this trade from his mother, since he grew up without a father. He gets up at 4:00 a.m. with his mother to get ready to go to the land parcel he rents. He spends the whole day working and at night is a caretaker at a farm. He buys fertilizer, seeds, poison, etc. in the city, walking 2 km to get to the main road to catch the bus that takes him to town where he buys the materials at a cheaper price. 

The loan he is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticide and herbicide to plant 7,000 square meters and pay to rent the land. With the harvest, he will have good income to support his mother and himself. He plans on buying some land to build his house and give his mother a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, pesticide, and herbicide to plant 7,000 square meters of corn and to pay to rent the land.

loans.name: Nigar

texts.ru:
Нигар 36 лет, имеет 5 детей. Нигар в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхозкультур, стартовав с суммы в (KGS) 2,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Нигар в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 коровы с приплодом,  1,40 га поливной земли кукурузой и свеклой.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нигар обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS)  на увеличение поголовья скота.  Доходы от кредита Нигар в ближайшее время планирует вложить в ремонт дома.
texts.en: Nigar is 36, and has five children. She supports her family by raising livestock and farming. After starting with 2000 som (KGS), Nigar's business, thanks to her hard work, now includes 2 cows with offspring, and 1.4 hectres of land planted in corn and beets. With the goal of expanding her business, Nigar has come to the Microlending Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 soms (KGS) to  expand her cattle herd. She plans to invest the proceeds obtained with the loan into repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Bubuaisha

texts.ru:
Бубуайше 44 года, имеет 3 детей. Бубуайша в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхозкультур, стартовав в 1994 году с суммы в (KGS) 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Бубуайша в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 корова с приплодом, 10 овец, 2,40 га поливной земли  с фасолью.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бубуайша обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку мелкого скота и удобрения.  Доходы от кредита Бубуайша вложит в приумножение поголовья скота, и мечтает построить новый дом для семьи.
texts.en: Bubuaisha is 44, and has three children. To support her family she raises livestock and farms; she started her business in 1994 with 10,000 som (KGS). Thansk to her hard work, her farm now has one cow with offspring, 10 sheep,and 2.4 hectares of land planted in beans. WIth the goal of expanding her business, Bubuaisha has turned to the Microlending Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock and fertilizer. Bubuaisha plans to invest the proceeds obtained with the loan into expanding her herd livestock herd, and dreams of building a new home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fertilizers

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan tiene 37 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Desde niño junto a sus hermanos se dedico a la agricultura y la crianza de ganado y en sus ratos libres le ayudaba a su padre en el taller de carpintería, a sus 15 años empezó a aprender de lleno la carpintería siempre al lado de su padre quien lo adiestraba y aprendió bien  este oficio. A sus 20 años se acompaño y empezó a trabajar de manera independiente a comprar poco a poco herramientas para trabajar, e instalo su propio taller de carpintería.  

La materia prima, las compra en las cerraderas más cercanas que esta a 5 kilómetros de su casa. Luego paga un medio de transporte para que le lleve la madera al taller; pero en algunas ocasiones tiene que trasladarse a lugares más lejanos para comprar la materia prima, cuando no encuentra en el mismo lugar.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar maquinaria para la carpintería, materia prima e insumos necesarios para la misma. Así, Prestara un mejor servicio de carpintería realizando con mas rapidez y de mejor calidad la producción aumentando sus clientes y mejorando la economía de su familia.

Los planes que tiene para su futuro, es ampliar con mas maquinaria y empleados su carpintería.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old. He has a spouse and three children. Since he was a child, he worked with his brothers in farming and raising cattle. In his free time, he helped his father in the carpentry workshop. When he was 15 he started to really learn carpentry with his father, who trained him. He learned the trade well. At 20 years old, he married and started to work independently to buy tools little by little, and then he set up his own carpentry workshop.

He buys the raw materials in the closest lumberyards which are 5 kilometers from his house. Later he pays for transport of the wood to the workshop, but on some occasions he has to go further away to buy the raw materials when he can't find it in the same place.

The loan he is asking Fundación Campo for is to buy machinery for carpentry, as well as raw materials and other materials he needs. This way, he will offer a better service, increasing his customers and improving his family's finances.

His plans for the future are to expand with more machinery and employees in his carpentry shop.

loans.use: to buy machinery for carpentry, raw materials, and other materials he needs.

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
